pmruc8veorqwrtmgvmFmvw.text: What a cute restaurant.  The server was friendly and informative, but the food was not to my liking.  My friend and I ordered a bunch of dishes to share and we could not pinpoint a favorite because they were all pretty mediocre.  The biggest laugh of it all?  The sticky rice.  It's $2 and it comes in this wicker type of basket thing.  When I pulled it out, it was wrapped in saran wrap.  And it was literally just a ball of rice.  My friend giggled as she said it looked like I was holding up a used condom.  I'm sorry, I'm sorry to be so harsh, but that is such a rip off.  It wasn't even sweet.  In my mind, when you order sticky rice, if it doesn't come with sliced mangoes, it should at least be covered with coconut milk.  Not just a ball of rice wrapped in saran wrap.  I cannot say I will be back but I can at least cross this one off my list of places to visit.

IqwXsktfkLN_Bwfo_AMQBw.text: Stopped by this enchanting little restaurant on my way home the other night and I'm so glad! It has to be the cutest Thai restaurant in Phoenix. The bartender was charming and he happily described the flavors in their unique specialty cocktails, making it easier to pick one. The food was delicious and different than what you find at most Thai restaurants in Phoenix. Everything was unbelievably light and flavorful! I can't say enough good things about Glai Baan. It was really great! I can't wait to go back!!

xz_4kTHK0aemvSIoWOZTPQ.text: This is THAI FOOD.   If you have Thai friends, and you eat with them a lot, they will fill you in on certain things. Such as, when eating Thai food, you typically use a spoon in the dominant hand, (fork in the other) and chopsticks are most often reserved for noodles. You may have also heard that Pad Thai, the dish everyone in the west thinks of as the quintessential Thai dish, is actually not very prolific in Thailand, and Thai folks are notoriously picky about the execution of this dish. In short, if you always order Pad Thai at Thai restaurants, you're doing it wrong.   However, at Glai Baan it's a different story. Pad Thai here is True Pad Thai. It's not overly oily, or sweet. It comes with lime to squeeze over it. The right kind of chives are used, and the flavors are subtle whilst still bold.   A highlight for me was the som tum (papaya salad) is also offered in the extra spicy rendition that features fermented crab legs. A dish like this is typically reserved for Thai customers, as a lot of folks find the ultra pungence of the crab to be off-putting. However, if you know this flavor and are sure you love it - you will not be disappointed here. This is hard to find!!!   Though all the dishes are faithful to authenticity whilst also showing a bit of tasteful creative attitude, the Nam tok was executed in a way that really elevated the dish. Aside from the perfectly toasted rice granules and rare beef, a sprinkling of micro fennel adds the perfect touch to this dish - and now I feel I must learn to grow this microgreen at home in order to enjoy nam tok properly. It's that good.   We sampled more than half of the menu, and tried various wines and beers throughout the meal. Thai food pairs best with cocktails, crisp white wines or wheat beer, and these are well represented at the bar. Personally, I tend toward rich reds when eating Thai, and the Cotes du Rhone blend served my palate well.   At the end of the meal we were surprised to discover that a favorite, and very hard-to-find in the states Thai dessert was available: pandan cream with soft bread, of which I cannot remember the Thai name. If you are unfamiliar with pandan, think of it as a subtle/quiet flavor for sweets. In the west, this might be akin to vanilla, but a bit more subtle. Whatever it is, I cannot get enough of it, and it is used in a wide variety of Thai desserts. At Glai Baan, they use a soft, thick bread similar to texas toast but more luxurious if that makes sense, and it is dipped in a custard cream imbibed with the soft, green goodness that is pandan. The sticky rice and mango dessert is mandatory, as you know - and it is also done to perfection, a faint flavoring of pandan is present in this as well.   As mentioned in several reviews, the ambiance here is soft, comfortable, yet not overly-dim. I'd feel most comfortable wearing something like beach-formal attire here, and I'll wait as long as needed in order to sit outside with the ficus trees and the strings of lights glowing softly in the branches. Magical, it is.   Really though, to our party who dined here last night, this place is the best. The menu is devoid of pretense, and based on the non-designed styling of the content of this menu that even I, as a graphic designer adore for several reasons, is updated as the offerings change. It would be a good idea to come often if one lived in Phoenix, as this environment, the staff and the plates they set before you are uplifting and inspiring.   I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Phoenix. Arroy mak, krab!

65g6oiXiP32Ko_9bDLaNNQ.text: Never heard "this is amazing" so many times at one dinner. The food is unbelievable. Highly recommend the dumplings and skewers.

4vOxnONzsnqYd0KvMzoK1Q.text: Let's just say that this little gem never ceases to amaze me ! Their crab fried rice is absolutely to die for !!!! Also check out their daily specials! gc3mdmSlaTf9uaVnJ-P3fA.text: Always amazing! There will be a wait so prepare for that but it is 100% worth it. Try the duck wings and the curry!!! The atmosphere is adorable and the patio is perfect!

1ocNX8yeqPpxd65SDjHHlQ.text: I want to keep Glai Baan all to myself! Alas, now you will know my deep secret, for this Thai food place is your next date night bistro, friend catch up scene, or place to take out of town diners.  Tucked away on Osborn and 24th, this itty bitty restaurant is cozy, romantic, dimly lit, and the setting for homecooked Thai food. We ordered three starters: steamed pork dumplings, papaya salad with crispy pork belly, and pork skewers in coconut milk and garlic - really, are you salivating yet? As mentioned before, everything tasted homecooked, and delicious. The steamed pork dumplings were made with love while the pork skewers were plump and tender. The papya salad was not far behind with fresh, crisp vegetables and yummy pork belly. For the entree, I ordered the Kapro Gai Kai Dao, or the minced chicken with onion, garlic, chili, Thai basil, egg, and rice. It sounds like a simple dish but this was jam-packed with flavor and complexity. It was one of the best Thai entrees I've had in a long time! Finally, I also ordered The Anywhere Door for my choice of beverage, which had Thai tea with rum. The flavors surprisingly went very smoothly together, and I sipped on it fairly quickly, so it was gone before I knew it. Do yourself a favor and treat 'yo self to Glai Baan. If you're a Thai food fan or foodie, you definitely won't regret it!

x6EoYq5wc-bsicN8LhuovQ.text: So my third time here. Beautiful night, sat outside. We had the Nua num tok, New York strip salad reminiscent of a larb. It was delicious with the toasted crispy rice!!! Yum. Then we had the kapro gai kai dao, stir fried mince chicken and rice. Soooooo really delicious. Our wine and cocktails enhanced the dinner. I won't even tell you about how good the mango and sticky rice was!! You'll have to come and taste for yourself. Another fantastic meal!!! Thank you Glai Baan!!!

4WmWbbvKoEp3QAfXUeWeiQ.text: I'll get the tiny negatives out of the way first: the parking lot is very poorly planned hahah so try parking on the street behind the strip mall. And also the wait can be super long so plan to wait (but you can order drinks while you do this, so that helps!) i wish they had the no wait service here so we could plan ahead.  The place is pretty cute inside with a lot of cool photographs of Thailand and kitschy Thai art. But the food is AMAZING. We ordered the muscles as an appetizer that came in a sauce so good we were spooning in into our mouths! We also ordered a fried oyster mushroom app that was on special which was really light and flavorful.  For my meal, i ordered one of the nightly special which was a thin glass noodle with fermented tofu. It was full of all my favorite Thai flavors! My first bite i looked up and said "oh yeah, i made the right decision." I was too busy eating my meal to taste anyone else's, but everyone enjoyed their entrees.

UvSb8iqwtmmStR_IauNDgA.text: Excellent food, wonderful staff, and great atmosphere.  It's wonderful to find a local establishment that serves authentic Thai food.  A fusion of street food, and various dishes served around Thailand including our favorite, Chang Mai, which I have found more difficult to find in the US. wICjAyY57yZNL5hmhPg3NA.text: Been there thaid that. Glai Baan is a hidden gem located in the inner city of Phx. I have never been to Thailand but I felt like I was there. The building itself was very cool and Thai land like. Ordered a delicious noodle plate. Hit the spot but could have eaten more. Highly recommended. Will definitely come back again

q_wEnxJpcfaFKlYlAvNceg.text: I've been coming to Glai Baan for about 2 years now.  I had written Thai food off in Phoenix until discovering this extraordinary place.   My go tos are Pad Kee Mow, Panang Curry, pork dumplings and Larb.   Cocktails are the bomb as well.  This is authentic Thai with impeccable friendly service.   Be prepared to wait for a table because it's always busy but it's well worth it. You can order drinks while waiting.   The Specialty cocktails are delicious.

HXHj89A2qLUAZgPEU9KhWw.text: Glai Baan has been getting a lot of hype lately and I really wanted to try it in hopes that the publicity has been warranted. The verdict is that it has been! First off the ambiance is very cozy, tastefully decorated, the dining area and bar are quite quaint and has a welcoming vibe. We started off at the bar since there was a wait for a table and had a hard time deciding which cocktail to try as they all sounded very interesting. I went with the Laab Sided which was a liquid cocktail version of laab and my husband had the Anywhere Door which was an alcoholic version of a Thai tea. How the bartender was able to get the flavors of laab into liquid form was very intriguing to me and I had to pick his brain on the recipe. He enthusiastically spoke to me about the process of inventing this sweet yet savory drink which is a must try.  Our table was ready, the menu had a lot of fantastic looking dishes. We of course had to try the Khao soi as it was my favorite dish that I had in Chiang Mai and is also one that I learned to cook at a cooking class there. Our server helped us with the rest of our choices, the pork dumplings and the special of mackerel fried rice. The dumplings were wonderful, you could tell how fresh they were. The Khao soi met my expectations, and tasted spot on with the ones that I had eaten in Thailand and the mackerel fried rice was to die for. Portion sizes were large and we were full about 3/4's of the way through, but it was one of those meals you couldn't let go to waste so we licked our plates clean even though we were stuffed!   Service was warm and welcoming from the front of the house, to the bartender and our waitress. All were very knowledgeable and willing to describe the dishes/cocktails to help make choices. Overall it was a well rounded fantastic experience, one of those places you will just want to eat your way through the menu. The hype is definitely deserved!

uVczkJdJ3bBcpvTSixDdbg.text: Adventurous. Been wanting to go here for over a year. Seems like the only days I thought about going  were on the days they were closed (Sunday and Monday I think). Well this time we made it (on a Wed). Went early (6pm) and got right in with no wait but there was a long wait when we were leaving FYI. We just ordered a bunch of small plates. 3 was not enough for 2 hungry people. The first 3 dishes were incredible! Why haven't we been coming here every night??? Space is really cozy. If I had to say to try one thing, it would be the mussels. That sauce was layered and surprising. We also had New York strip and steamed pork dumplings. Yum! We ordered another 3 for good measure but were underwhelmed by the second course. Crab papaya salad - couldn't figure out how to eat, only had tiny hard crab shells (was I supposed to crack those to suckers to get crab?). Additionally, was so spicy  , it burnt my tongue (and I like spicy), couldn't eat, which made me sad. Then the chicken wings were pretty flavorless and had too much breading. We ended with pork skewers which were really good! The restaurant was super sweet and offered a delicious birthday dessert, which was a pistachio custard and sweet bread for dipping. Over all it was really fun to try this place and I will definitely return. Seriously, be adventurous and try the mussels!

uEWXZKOVrKC5dR6DmODhbg.text: This is the best Thai in Phoenix!  The location is adorable, the manager is amazing at navigating  the waiting customers, and the service is impeccable!  I will be back!

0xpr4uqZiYStnfWzBwgX1g.text: Amazing!!  The wings the dumplings and the mussels are the best way to start. Then for your main dish you cannot go wrong. And then for dessert order both desserts. I tell you ALL the dishes on the menu are tasty and so delicious!!!  It's a small place so expect to wait but it's worth it.

vRqtdsgR7NJYJ8S2g35lkw.text: I know nothing about Thai food. But I know what I like, and I like Glai Baan. So will you.   With an emphasis on "street food", they specialize in spicy small plates you won't see much of anywhere else. And...well, noodles. But unlike the million 'tapas' places popping up, it likes to be warm and cozy. Not flashy at all. Water served slightly cool in tiny tin cups. Food on flimsy plates. No ambient lights or DJs or anything. It is humble, but I don't think it needs all the bells and whistles of trendier competition to be successful.  I am really not much of a noodle person, but I gave the pad kee mao a try and was not disappointed. Think Pad Thai, but with pork. Included with the plate was a large serving of uncut green onions, bean sprouts, and dry spices (salt, peanuts, and chili flakes) as opposed to the array of sauces I'm accustomed to for this cuisine. They will warn you about spice, which I love because I'm tired of your sensitive palates ruining it for the rest of us.  I paired this with an innovative selection from their limited cocktail list: The Thai Hive (Jasmine Gin, Chili Honey, lemon juice, fish sauce) sounds stomach-turning but is refreshing, tart, and packs a wallop. Other drinks feature baiju, black vinegar, or even shallots and toasted rice.   This is the innovation we NEED in the local dining scene, all at reasonable portions and price points. I'm already excited to return!

OeHpAxdSwLpR5uTNOID7PA.text: I love this place. Super cute & located in an old house.  Staff is really sweet and we love the mushrooms, and the Pad Kee Mao is delicious. The Panang Curry is always good and don't miss the dessert with fresh baked bread.  The only thing I didn't love was the Mackerel Fried Rice, but everything else we've had has been very good. Be prepared for a wait, especially on weekends.

Ao-nckoqUkiqh_7gzomrog.text: Finally got the chance to go to this wonderful place. Better yet, my foodie friend joined me also, so we could order to our hearts' content. We ordered Kanom Jeeb (steamed pork dumplings with scallion ginger soy sauce), Silom Road Moo Ping (Pork skewers with garlic Jaew sauce), Son-in-Law Eggs (fried soft-boiled eggs topped with fried shallots served with sweet, salty and sour sauce), Penang Curry (braised beef, roasted pepper, bamboo shoot, and Thai basil) and Pan Fried Glass Noodles with Shrimp and Pork Belly. Everything was delicious! The taste of the Penang Curry reminded me so much of Indonesian's famous dish: Beef Rendang. If Sriracha or dried chili powder are not extra hot enough for you, you can ask for chopped Thai bird chilies. Max, our server was awesome also. Too bad they don't open for lunch. Will definitely want to go back here again and try something else.

KAQR_OCFYn_GX_bv9SaE-w.text: What a cute little place! I was in town for a short trip and my friend who's a local wanted to bring me here. We stopped in to grab a quick snack and a bottle of wine. This place is a family home flipped into a restaurant. My friend is a regular here so we were greeted with big smiles and the hosts, servers, and bartenders all introduced themselves to me. It was a very nice personal touch. The host was super communicative and updated us constantly on how long our wait would be for a table. Service was superb! We ordered the panang curry and also shrimp pad Thai as well as a bottle of wine. I wish I was more hungry so I could've eaten a full meal here but even the little that we had I enjoyed it. I'll definitely come back again!

Or72IWSaUswbVpj3OxguSw.text: I think this is my new fav thai restaurant. I like the open atmosphere and the food is yummy. Staff is also friendly and attentive. Overall service was quick when I was there. Granted I did come early around 5 ish when they just open.  To whoever interested to try out this place out, beware limited parking space.   Looking forward to my next visit.

M9JuwCqEN79DkJ-EeSaNmA.text: I absolutely love Glai Baan! Everyone was so warm, inviting and it just felt like family. Our server Gerardo (I think was his name) was the best of the best. He recommended some amazing dishes that we were so happy to try. We just got back from Thailand two weeks ago and I have to say, everything at Glai Baan tasted so authentic! The glass noodle dish tasted as if I just bought it from a street vendor in Chiang Mai. My absolute favorite was definitely the green curry noodle, they only had it on special that night so I'm not sure you'll be lucky enough to taste that one. I also had the mackerel fried rice which was full of flavor. The ambiance was perfect, as if you were on a Bangkok street late night surrounded by tons of people at the night market! 10/10 recommend

IAE10ec7AZUTHO-PsX5Rcg.text: I love this place, it has a nice vibe and the servers are very friendly, especially the bartender Max! It's a cozy place for a casual date and the food is awesome!

xDEvZoZbbeogsGbF0yJOig.text: Glai Baan currently operates out of the building that previously housed Mejico Cocina Mejicana, a pretty decent Mexican eatery that I was sad to see close its doors earlier this year. Their specialty is what they refer to as "Thai Street Food," which appears to a combination of the traditional Thai dishes you're familiar with, combined with items that only hardcore fans of the food will probably recognize. It's an interesting concept that already appears to be generating a bit of a buzz on the social media circuit, although I'm still not sure what falls under the "street food" umbrella.  My girlfriend and I stopped by on a Saturday night and unexpectedly found the place to be pretty crowded. I've always liked the setup of the restaurant, with a nice, outdoor patio that's closed off with a wood-fence, giving the place sort of a "backyard" feel to it.   As usual, we ordered a couple of Thai teas. They offer an alcoholic variation on the drink, but we prefer keeping things basic. Their Thai tea is different in the sense that, it wasn't really sweet and did not have that ultra-mliky flavor that we've become accustomed to. This might make it different, but didn't necessarily make it better, in my opinion. We both agreed that we prefer the way it's usually prepared at other places - which is also cheaper than the four dollar asking price. But that's just personal preference, I guess.  For food, we started off with the silom road moo, which are basically pork skewers that were great quality and included a bit of very mildly spicy sauce for dipping. Additionally, we chose a dish that I cannot find on the most recently posted menu. It combined noodles with shrimp and a few other additions, one of which, had a very strange smell and acidic "bite" to it. My girlfriend liked it a bit more than I did. The smell reminded me of things I'd rather not mention in the review.  For main dishes, it was a rather tricky process. My girlfriend generally dislikes spicy food, while I can handle almost anything - or so I thought. Her options were very limited, since the majority of the items are noted as being spicy. She chose the ka na moo grob, which included stir fried broccoli, pork belly, rice, and what is referred to as a "son in law" egg. I went for the pad kee mao, which included a boatload of ingredients, including pork belly, broccoli, mushrooms, bamboo shoot, rice, egg, and both some chili and garlic.  Okay, so I'll openly admit that everything was very good quality. But as one of the other reviewers noted, the dishes are just so-damned-spicy! They don't do scales here, but my dish clearly hovered in the level 4-5 that you'd find at most traditional Thai restaurants. After a couple of bites, I could not really appreciate the food's quality, because the chili flakes completely dominated the entire dish.  My girlfriend's dish, on the other hand, was not listed as being spicy, but still was to the point where she had difficulty eating it. Chili flakes were still very much present. While it was definitely less harsh than mine, it was still spicy enough that the server should have inquired about her tolerance level. Once again, I'll state that the dish itself was very good quality, but after a few bites, it became very difficult to appreciate. I'm convinced that they actually overdid hers on accident.  We both quickly developed runny noses and watery eyes as a result, while listening to a table full of twenty-somethings that were situated way too close to our table, huffing and puffing through each bite for the same reason. Clearly, my spice tolerance isn't as high as I had originally assumed, as it took a good twelve hours before my body felt "normal" again after the spice wreaked total havoc on my digestive tract.   For dessert, they offer some steamed bread that's served with a dipping custard, which wasn't available. Instead, we opted for this alternative special, which included a slice of pumpkin that had some hardened custard inside, served with condensed milk. It was okay, but would have preferred to try their primary offering. Oh well.  Ultimately, while the food is good quality and will probably please a lot of people, I just can't bring myself to give the place more than two stars. I'm sure I'll receive death threats as a result. For the price we paid, we didn't really get a lot of food - and what little we did take with us, neither one of us will probably eat. Currently, this place is receiving glowingly positive reviews, but without an established spice-level system, I'd suggest being very careful about what you order unless you have a stomach made out of iron.  I'd recommend them, because I feel it's a place that everyone should at least try once. The environment is nice, although they only get partial credit - as this building had a nice vibe long before they occupied the space. But for us, personally, I think we'll stick to some of our established favorites.

MaMEal5Mwr4s78ck2V-hxw.text: Charming atmosphere with great food and service! Dishes were authentic with the right amount of spice and heat. 4CBgRsMPnZOdaO-VHiumog.text: Finally, there's a neighborhood Thai restaurant with a delightful ambiance. We gone there twice now and loving sitting at the bar. Every time I go I try something new.  Cocktails are refreshing too!  Skip the white washed Thai places in Phoenix and go here for a real experience.

W9ncw3GfonRWhRzTnPVU4Q.text: Came here last weekend with some friends. We had a group of 5 total. We were told it would be about an hour wait as they only had 3-4 tables which could accommodate this group size. Okay, we had heard good things and were willing to wait. Someone in our party pointed out a few minutes later that there was a table outside that was available for a larger group and wondered if that was ours. After waiting for a few more minutes without them getting us for that empty table, we just assumed they were waiting to seat our group inside, which was totally fine with us as it was a colder evening. However, after waiting for over an hour we inquired as to how much longer it would be and were told we would be seated next. They cleared out a table inside and we assumed it would be ours since we were next. However, they seated ANOTHER group at that table! We again inquired as to why we weren't seated yet and they realized there had been a mix-up. A few minutes later, we were seated at the table outside.....WHICH HAD BEEN EMPTY THE ENTIRE HOUR+ THAT WE HAD WAITED!!!!! Our group ordered immediately hoping our food would come out quickly. It did not. The food then took another hour until it came out and every. single. person's. dish came out separately with at least 5-10 minutes in between. So it was either sit there and wait another 50 minutes for everyone's dish to come out and let your food get cold, or eat individually as the others sat and stared. After these insanely long waits for our (empty) table and food, we expected the food to be amazing and were sorely disappointed to realize it was just okay. I would definitely not recommend coming to this place unless you don't mind waiting an insane amount of time for everything unnecessarily.

rDPAL653t5u7QsNKFRDbVw.text: Went tonight for the first time, and I really loved this place... The food was delicious. It was by far the best Thai food I've ever had in Phoenix and, honestly, among the best meals I've had here, period. The pad thai is wonderful, and so is the larb. We also had a special: panang curry with beef ribs. It was really tasty and complex.  The building is lovely and has a garden with outdoor seating, too. Prices are reasonable for the quality.  They're still working out the kinks with some service stuff (they've only been open for nine days), but everyone was super friendly.

laQzb3O66denY0LjgKrc8A.text: We called in 15 minutes before kitchen closed, we asked if we could put in our order and we were told no you'll be ok to order just come on in. It took us 15 minutes to get there, we got in and was told sorry kitchen is closed. We told the manager what was told to us on the phone. He made no exception to accommodate the fact we drove 15 minute and even called ahead of time. I'm an owner if I truly couldn't get the kitchen to cook because it's broken down and already closed up I'd at least show an attempt of gratitude in us wanting to eat there and the fact we called before Driveing 15 min. There was no Welcoming  us back with a discount, or a card with his name stating he wails take care of us the manager could care less I told him I was upset and I would have handled the situation better. I did tell him the way he handled it I would be writing a review. He walked me out to the door and basically said by Felicia like he could give a damn.

zZo0MK1hu8L7uG1PnexF1g.text: So delicious! First of all, they have Kao soi which I love and isn't always easy to find. qvmub0eOc98KVeIAVo2Eyg.text: OMG !!! The best most flavorful Panang curry ever. Its not the usual watered down, coconut milky curry. 7gs_lFepWI4ETdRkvNIe-A.text: I've enjoyed quite a few dinners at Glai Baan (means far from home) & would highly recommend this terrific Thai restaurant to family, friends & strangers!  Not only does the food itself exceed expectations - the ambience, service & personal attention to guests contribute to an outstanding dining experience!

Q5Flz80rt1-xwqLU5NQJiQ.text: Our first time at this neighborhood place did not disappoint. We sat at the bar where we enjoyed conversation with bartender Maxwell. This boozy Thai tea was so yummy and this entree was great for sharing! A welcomed addition to neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Cu64shyUs9QwlqfyPFEwnQ.text: I made my return visit, as promised. Much better this time! A friend and I got the dumplings (which were strangely not as good as the first time, but still good), son in law eggs (so savory and delish), the ground chicken and rice dish with the fried egg, and the pad kee Mao (this time with crispy pork belly, which wasn't an option last time, but cost an additional 1$). The entrees were super good. The pad kee Mao was so much better this time..... I asked for spicy (again) but this time they made it SPICY !  The heat was perfectly balanced with basil leaves and did not overtake the flavor of the dish while still making my nose run. It was, unfortunately, way too spicy for my buddy, but, hey.... If you ask for spicy, can't complain about the heat. The crispy pork belly was so much better than the original.... It cut down on that weird gelatinous texture you can get from pork belly and left you with crispy, yet tender pieces of meat. The ground chicken dish was also a winner.... It was super savory with a touch of sweetness.... The egg was fried crispy on the bottom and still slightly runny on the top.... It was awesome. Additionally, the leftovers were fabulous! The only down sides I can see are A) the inconsistency.... Last time was not so good.... This time was great and B) the price..... Their prices are kinda outrageous. A plate of noodles in Phoenix should probably not cost 15$. I understand they cannot charge Thai prices (in Thailand, I got plates of noodles for 1$), but this isn't new york city either. I spent 30$ for dinner, which is a bit high for Thai food. Anyway, will the price keep me from coming back? No.... But I definitely won't come as often as I would if plates were closer to the 10-12$ range.

AZFYlrD9GeODw6W5yWHeDA.text: Nice patio, this place smells delicious. Service very nice, presentation nice and food delicious will definitely be back. Mussels turned my (friends) crank.

TQC4XmQJj_U4iGaKFe3Jyw.text: Tried this place on a recommendation from one of our fav bartenders. It's so good! We sampled at least half the small plates. All were wonderful! sow9Dk_4Rj66wEj_valZgg.text: I've had alot of Thai food over the years.  Had the red curry  beef  which was perfectly cooked.  Fork tender and delicious.  Gorgeous lemongrass slow cooked into dish. bfyE7DYZWXjaTWlqKhzJZg.text: Made the trek out here the other day based on reviews this was more authentic than the rest of Phoenix...  While this may be True it wasn't quite the experience we thought it would be. Don't let that detract you from going, though. The food we tried from the somewhat limited menu was pretty good. I'd stop short of calling it our new go to Thai due to the lack of some staple items such as yellow and green curry. I'd say it felt more like a gourmet fusion influenced by Thai. That being said, the establishment has a cozy feel and an awesome, romantic patio setting that you'll enjoy sharing on date night. The staff are super nice and attentive.

9e55PpBsFJKxi3tBXzAXFQ.text: This is the BEST Thai food I have eaten! The raw shrimp appetizer is the perfect blend of spice, lime, mint, cilantro with crispy cabbage. TYDlbdV5TgOVzVMgT_YnDA.text: This place is amazing! My hubby and I are so happy we came here,great service & amazing food!!!! All around great vibes!

XP8VMhDPk-qgAYvyu2L-UQ.text: This is the best restaurant I've ever been to in my entire life I love the food the people experience the happiness of the culture here inside this restaurant I am going to cry as I continue to think about this what a beautiful restaurant five stars all around great job guys

Q6MELvy7YXdMydH5gV_rvA.text: Wooo buddy, what a wonderful little spot here in central Phoenix. The owner is a wonderful gentleman that is always operating in the front of the house. I've always had great service and the food is impeccable. I recommend this place to a lot of people. The menu is a good size with nice options and they always have specials. If you're picky with your Thai, they can also venture off the menu and will make a favorite dish of yours if you inquire.

pBSdMBtQuRKraO3Dr5rsCg.text: Best Thai we've had in Phoenix. Have to agree with most of the reviews. Priced about the same as other Thai places,  portions are smaller but they make up for it by very tasty dishes. Our favs are the Smoked Mackeral Fried Rice, Pork Dumplings and Pork Skewers. Probably the best Thai Ice Tea I've had and they also serve one spiked with rum. The Coconut Custard dessert was a nice finish to the evening.

l8G5KUvO1s9s-GNBXXOXfg.text: The absolute best Thai food...a small menu but deliciously prepared dishes. A quaint atmosphere and aexceptional service. We tried all the day's specials, and loved them all.

JxRnaBK_JTSkKv43BcR-Qw.text: Authentic thai food!! I was surprised and delighted! The ambiance was a nice casual with indoor and outdoor seating available. Very clean. It was packed for a Wednesday night as well! Service was great-- friendly and informative staff who seem to really enjoy their work.   The foooood: we tried several dishes. The food here was authentic and not "americanized," even down to the use of asian long beans rather than american green beans. I felt transported to Bangkok and I could envision the seasoned older ladies cooking there. Everything was fresh and flavors were well-balanced. The spiciness level is True to asian spice levels.   I LOVED the mackerel fried rice. So much umami flavoring!! The drunken noodles were also very different from other places I've been to. These noodles were not overly saturated with soy sauce and had a cleaner taste. The fried chicken appetizer was delic. Larb moo was right on. The one thing i wish could have been done differently was that the cabbage could have been chopped and easier to eat. Same thing with the cabbage served with the salted crab papaya salad. Also, we were warned about the crab being different from most people's expectations, but it was still surprising to get a papaya salad with tiiiiiny bits of shelled crab nevertheless. I couldn't eat the crab because it was impossible to get the meat out, but I did try to suck out the juice which was good. I might just get a normal papaya salad next time. The flavors were excellent.   We also had the pandan custard dessert. I could see real bits of pandan leaf, so they certainly don't use artificial flavoring--and the flavor is consistent with use of fresh ingredients! The custard kept cooking in the steaming basket, so toward the end the custard curdled. However, I don't think anyone would notice if they weren't really into baking and cooking. This dessert reminded me of a famous custard/toast restaurant in bangkok. I was happy to be reminded :)  Overall, excellent thai food. It's hard to actually judge thai food bc so many places produce the same flavors. However, this place was different enough for me to write a yelp review. If you don't really know your thai food, maybe you wouldn't notice the difference, but I certainly appreciate the subtleties. I would definitely return :)

6aZQ-O0LK6byOi9CfJL85g.text: I was very happy with the meal and drinks. It s small place so except a wait as it's not a secret. The drinks were very inventive and very enjoyable. Then we had the chicken wings, larb, and papaya salad. All very well done no big standout but all very nice. For entrees we had prik king, ka na mo grab, and Panang Curry. They were all great but I though the Panang curry was the star of the entrees. All in all a great Thai dinner. We will definitely be back.

sEa3G_2fVoRKgCif_NJO4g.text: Glai Baan has been somewhere I've passed on many occasions, but following a trusted friends recommendation, I stopped in for a light snacks.  The place is quaint, formerly a failed Mexican restaurant which seemed to have come and gone in a matter of weeks, I am please to find the place vibrant at 10:15pm, a spattering of people at the bar and dotted around sparsely at tables, inside and out.  Staff were a little 'more' attentive than necessary, but by no means annoying, lets just say on the keen side, which is a plus compared to many.  I chose the wings and the NY Strip salad, which I had been considering since looking at the menu online. It really was tasty and filling, despite the apparently small serving. The 'Micro greens' which accompanied the steak was actually more of a subtle camouflage for the unexpectedly generous amount of beef beneath. The chicken wings were indeed crispy and very pleasantly seasoned, an interesting tamerind based dip accompanying.  I've no doubt more substantial food is great too.   I highly recommend the place. I hope you enjoy as much as I did.

ZoApzIO26u_ok2fRyy3NLA.text: Really delicious and the staff is great! It's a really small venue and parking is limited. You may need to park a block down. There is most likely going to be a wait since it's small too. I wouldn't suggest for a large group. I would cap it at 4 people at most, and that's if you're willing to sit outside. But, I find that it is worth the wait. Servers are super nice. My friend and I were seated at the bar, and they were great at giving recommendations and telling about the specials. I got the jungle curry (special) and my friend got the tom yum. Very flavorful, and not terribly expensive! You'll probably look at $13-16 depending on the entree. If you like alcohol, their drinks look super awesome. My friend grabbed one, and we said we were going to share it just to try. Bartender was kind enough to separate them into glasses for us too! (We didn't even ask!) Since we were at the bar, we could tell the bartender really was meticulous about his work!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink with fish sauce

gK06owsk8Xc3irl_-75TQA.text: This is one of my favorite Thai spots! The best part other then the food, the staff, the owner and the ambience, it's open late!   This place never gets old.

aufKn1fb_31lamy401UkpA.text: Loved our first experience at Glai Baan. When we walked in, it was a positive zoo- which surprised us for a Wednesday night.  However, we were able to snag seats to order dinner from the Bar.  I studied Yelp for suggestions and looked at friends photos to determine some of the better plates to order. We decided on a bunch of small plates to share and proceeded to order 5 dishes.  We settled on the Salted Crab & Papaya salad- which is a staple. We also tried the pork Dumplings, which were delicious. Last, we ordered a dish of minced pork and the Son-in-law eggs (deep fried soft boiled eggs).   From the nightly special we ordered raw shrimp (side note- I dont think I've ever had raw uncooked shrimp- the sauce accompanied it was delicious). Also had the crispy beef ribs- which were more to nibble on.  Lastly, desert was a traditional Thai street food desert of sweet bread and a very sweet cream to dip it in. It was light and airy and delicious! Can't wait to come back in and order the other 1/2 is the menu we didn't get to yet!

Bs5MIWN6AyJ00R4kmJA5IA.text: Small place but food with big flavors. The Panang curry was so rich and flavorful - my 8 month old shoved his hand in it and turns out he loves spicy food! They had a high chair but only one and it was antique. Overall, will definitely be back.

aAugNzco3DHP3PzAOJPM_A.text: I'm shook that anyone could leave any thing less than 5 stars. First of all this is a small local business that makes incredible food and hands down the best customer service in town. They were out of dumplings one night and they straight up brought the table the most delicious mango sticky rice. & while you're at it don't forget to try any one of their cocktails they're all fantastic! Favorite place to go anytime we have date night 10 stars in my book. Suoer consistent and ran by the sweetest people.

BsuBZVS6z5Htf_Ca__Wh9A.text: Simply the best thai food restaurant in the valley but don't expect thai food you'll find just anywhere. It's thai street food, I can't even recommend any one thing because everything I've ever had here has been fantastic.   From the drinks, to the small plates, to the entrees and specials.  You can't go wrong. Not only is their food amazing, so is the service and the ambiance.   I've been coming here for a year I believe and I will keep coming back here regularly.   Truly amazing!

Tiznbdr9IF2jzAQ4FEq7EQ.text: This place is delicious. I also love the atmosphere.  We had almost every small plate and the were all incredibly tasty - my favorite was the pork dumplings.  I would also highly recommend the pork belly in any of their larger plates, the pad kee mao was flavorful and the spice was spot on!!!

zIO0aVXiS_8G5MndpPkrsw.text: This is the Neighborhood kitchen and dining space that gets the feel and taste all so damn good it just leaves you saying "f*ck that's good".  The feel and look of the space is like going to your moms house with a full bar.  The cocktail selection are creative and fresh.  I left the ordering to my partner in crime who ordered I think dumplings and noodles with some thai magic becuase it was F*CKING DELISH!  I ordered the Pad Thai and  was just silent since I was busy stuffing my face.  Not even the slightest I could disagree with anything from Service to Atmosphere because everything was on point!  Happy Staff make for Happy Guests :)

idQaZD2RSX8cM6fussuq6g.text: Wanting some Thai food with no boundaries? Glai Bann is your off the chart spot! Very quaint spot with an amazing staff that makes you feel like your in Thailand. Maxwell who has been at this location since day 1 is so knowledgeable and very upbeat and pleasant. He guided up through the menu. Starting with the pork dumplings are such a treat that i am still dreaming about them, we followed that with a papaya salad which was interesting but delicious followed by a bowl that was rice, diced chicken and topped with a fried egg this is plenty  for a party of two share.  Make sure to make reservations if you have a party over 2 and make sure to ask questions.  Thank you Maxwell we look forward to seeing you soon and working our way around the menu.  Enjoy!!!

EhVs6mI0VwhhRgMBCQFc3g.text: The drinks food and service were awesome.  Fun chill music and fun cocktails.  It is small but worth waiting to sit.

_itE-_6vOVycNKsQEshDRA.text: This restaurant is by far one of the best thai restaurants in Phoenix! Very well worth the wait, the hospitality is incredible, the staff very welcoming and friendly. The food and drinks exceed expectations. A must try!

_sgwMG5E5bFlA7YLFtFFcw.text: Food tastes so good, drinks are refreshing and the place is cool. This is not your regular Thai restaurant. Their food is "street" food Thai with a twist.  We tried almost all of their food in the menu and we're really happy about their food. We can't ask for more. Just amazing food.

ccwZ3Pbpe2c7WJLqV_QiVQ.text: Love the food especially the pork belly with veggies and egg. The give us awesome the drinks are awesome. Only thing is that the servings are pretty tiny so it would be best to add more food on the plate (:

qUqBScpxz5Hg56KbgTuYIA.text: Came to this hole in the wall joint and was blown away by the truly unique and innovative food!. There's around 10 tables or so inside so it is very snug, however the food is hands down the best Thai food I've had in AZ! I had the red curry which was mildly spicy and the dumplings which were both to die for.  Service was friendly and very time efficient. I noticed our server was one of few, and he was bouncing from table to table. But our food came out relatively fast and he kept asking us if we needed anything. The server also informed us they have one person in the back who is the only cook and they do everything! That made my level of appreciation sky rocket! They were pretty busy on a weekend with limited parking and places to wait, but I promise the food is worth it 100%! The dumplings were divine and perfect to simply put it. The texture and taste were on point. And the curry was full of flavor with the chicken being a very good quality. Also cooked to perfection.

1oVURI1TjI6ST_GIv7EdsA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!! The food is unreal delicious. We started off with the pork dumplings, then had the panang curry and the kao soi. AMAZING authentic flavors. The patio outside has little tables with trees and decorations and is definitely the spot to eat.

Ue8yAeKHvWTAVr8Gr5dvPg.text: Fun, friendly, trendy neighborhood gem.  Food was delicious,, but kinda more of the small plate side with a Thai street food theme so they didn't have my usual go to dishes.  Thai tea was VERY good and take this as biblical warning ... you can add spice, but not remove it ... don't be a show off and make a scene....telling ya get it on the side ... think their spice may be the hottest that has passed my lips and I LOVE spice...

Vf5MQTQr2NBbZpN64SW4zg.text: Glai Baan easily the best Thai restaurant in all of Phoenix.   This adorably delicious restaurant exceeded all expectations. What we have here my friends is a serious contender perhaps for a James Beard award for some of the best Thai food in the USA. I do not exaggerate.   Yes, the street food themed menu is somewhat limited, but of what I tested every single dish is probably five stars or even higher.   I don't claim to be an expert at Thai food but I do enjoy it as often as possible.   My favorite Thai destination is "Lotus of Siam" in Vegas which for me is the standard by which I compare the rest. I went here late last night for the first time late (by myself) and I can say that *every single dish* that I ordered including the steamed pork dumplings were absolutely off the charts scrumptious.   The noodle and meat dish that I ordered (Pad Kee Mao) was ordered three stars in terms of the heat (they use a 4 star heat system), and I can tell you that the dish was perfectly quite spicy (as a matter fact hotter than I can usually handle), but I absolutely loved it - as the tastes were so incredibly good that the heat was a party in my mouth. Perfect to wash down with my Singh ha beer.   But It's not just the tastes here that are amazing, it's also the *textures* if that makes sense. Every dish had a depth of complexity to it with unexpected flavor notes even for someone like me that loves Thai food. The wide noodles had a good al dente bite to them, not soggy or over-cooked. And the unexpected pleasures were not just the flavors but as I said the textures - which for me was surprising. Crunches here. Soft bites there. Savory here. Sweet there. Wow.   The service was also exceptional and Dan the owner (who stopped by to chat) was passionate, caring and you could tell that he really took not only the food seriously... but every customer was the focus...making sure things were smooth and that the food was to your liking.   I will be returning very soon!   We are so lucky to have an incredible restaurant like this locally. The vibe is adorable, very cool and kind of Bohemian.    I just love this place. Winner.

JQY_EYSY9-71hu4DocNI0Q.text: Went here a few weeks ago with my friend Brian. Everything was really great. Owners are very nice and friendly. Service was excellent.

jGNkFgeWK2ZlED6QsffOew.text: I would give them more stars if I could! The owners are so accommodating and the service is phenomenal. On top of that, the owner/chef has brought back from Thailand her authentic dishes and touches to the restaurant. My hubby and I go probably once a week since we live so close and love to order the son-in-law eggs and sticky rice. Well probably try every dish by the end of the month. So happy to see an excellent restaurant open in our neighborhood!!!

IuOO90HHb3vE_dqUEsRLyA.text: Convenient location and open till midnight. Menu wasn't too extensive  but had good selections. We ordered the Red curry brisket special which was great! The pad Thai however was a bit on the bland side for my taste. We had to add a lot of spice to give it that extra flavor. Overall a good atmosphere and a pleasant experience.

0OH6lvP4yPBcvaQciiP3jw.text: I didnt know what to expect but went on a thursday night with four friends and service and food were great, served in very reasonable time and nice cozy ambiance and lighting all around. We even felt like we werent in Phoenix, and more in a small house with bushes and trees around. I have absolutely no complaints.

SPOvwOdVCfiLxXpZtSLHvg.text: I am yearning to go back to Glai Baan!!!! The food is beyond words! We did some small plates that were all fantastic. The dumplings especially are amazing! All the noodle dishes are so so awesome!!!!! Want to go back and try more.

AgKB6FLOeFVBOTrudSOn9Q.text: This place is freaking delish. All the stars, all of them. So impressed. Authentically Thai.

VxOlhvJ9fuOKM_AsGfmMNA.text: Potstickers were great. Wine selection and advice was great. Pad thai was good, different style than what we're used to. Loved the patio seating, but hostess/servers seemed to be on different pages at times. Good experience overall!

5ecMiMlSAZw1lqclJY1NcA.text: This place just opened around the corner from my house, so naturally I was excited to try it. Ordered pad Thai and crab fried rice to go. Was asked on the phone my spice level and ordered as mild as possible. Food was pretty pricy and portions VERY small. A hungry man would need to order two entrees to be satisfied. The flavor was good and food was enjoyable, however it was SO spicy. The food was visibly coated in lots of red pepper flakes. My lips haven't stopped burning and my nose was running the whole time. Having ordered mild, it was so spicy it wasn't enjoyable after a few bites...which is good because you only get a few bites. 2 stars solely for flavor. Bigger portions or more reasonable prices and accuracy of "mild" would make this review a 5.

-VActCAgbNEwA75W9T6HPQ.text: Very unique spin to Thai food, everything I tried was full of flavor and fresh! Great service at the bar. Definitely be back!

ykS1YEwUgcyX0PGuQHi3cQ.text: I went here with my boyfriend; we have gone twice now. It is really good Thai food and the service is great too. It is authentic Thai and feels homey. We love going here.

JjIHK5ZwDxi2nglRQO5PVQ.text: Great little Thai spot to check out.  I loved the pork dumplings so much I ordered them twice! The interior of the place is nicely done while still retaining a casual vibe. So many nice details on the dishes and the decor. Come check this place out.

1lTdGgMbhs0T_FBfIheyfg.text: Enjoyed dinner on a Saturday - patio dining due to a perfect November evening.  The bartender was very friendly and happy to share pronunciations and explanations of food/drink.  Once our dumplings arrived we moved to the patio.  I asked if they could turn 'up' the music as the dead space could have been filled with some relaxing tunes.  We ordered the spicy papaya salad, a noodle and rice dish...all delicious!!! Food came out quickly, service fairly attentive, and overall we are hooked on the dumplings...back next time for those and perhaps soup!!

voISPS2I8Ki3q8PA_DR7Mg.text: I've never had Thai food like this both in presentation and taste. That's not to say other Thai places in Phoenix aren't good, it's just that this was really exciting and unique. Great location too. It's more expensive than other Thai places probably but I felt it was deserved. If your exposure to thai is mostly pad Thai do yourself a favor and try the less familiar dishes they serve (Also the pad Thai there is great )

8Z3zEXklGEEDZE85PdC12Q.text: Great food, great service. On request my friend received an individual dish by the cook. Back any day

-lb9e5SZFn3HiVs6zlrw_A.text: The restaurant is quaint and intimate. While the tremendous service is the same. The servers were informative and walk you through the menu. The cocktails were unique and playfully concocted. I literally have no words for how on point the flavor combinations were in the food. I will be back to try everything on the menu.

K8q-vu77ECun_ksLuBAMAw.text: Hands down our favorite. Phenomenal service, food is out of this world. It's the whole package!!

az_gfLLa_0cmrY1IER8z2A.text: My wife and I went here last week and were extremely happy with the service, food and ambiance.   One of the best Thai restaurants in town.  We highly recommend the dumplings, pork skewers, Pad Lee Mao and Kai Soi.   All very flavorful and great portion sizes.  Sit at their bar before dinner and have some of their great cocktails.  We highly recommend this spot!

15Son9ezhJ16ZBTUq5e0yA.text: Yes!! Do it! Great street food from all regions of thailand! The grilled pork skewers were perfectly charred. The papaya salad was fresh and bright. The cocktails were unique and delicious as well.

tFH7D59o2SE8Lz2OF-h3Kg.text: We came here for a friend's birthday at the end of April. It was just cool enough to sit outside without bring too warm. We started with almost one of each of the appetizers. All were so good! We ordered one of each of the pail drinks. The coconut one was better IMO. Every one enjoyed they food and beverages. I highly recommend the drink with the fish sauce! Don't be scared! It's lovely!

YNRLYdhUXrbe_V1F3zTz0w.text: The service is great. The food is high quality. Rotating specials, indoor/outdoor seating, overall a great experience. The food is a little pricey but worth it!

ciilbooURekUs43cmuWu7w.text: Glai Baan is a gem and should be considered a pilgrimage worthy destination for Thai food lovers across Phoenix. They do everything well and the service is top notch.

Ti2VDrAaPyhEVS3btMOQzg.text: Their pork potstickers is worth the price of entry alone. Good ambience, nice staff. Definitely recommended.

KK3OOV42YAu1XW97AiX1aA.text: Delish lil place!  Open till midnight on Friday and Saturday which is awesome. We had fantastic service and the food was great. Looking forward to coming bacm

u-BlONp7rqQrMWzM2ZtG1A.text: Have you ever seen a person that's almost a 10 in real life, and then boom, their personality came out and its so bad that it knocks them down to at best a 2? That's Glai Baan. Don't get me wrong, the food was tasty, the hipster vibe was dope. The hidden gem of a place was what we all expected except the management... nooooo.   Our reservation was made 2 weeks ago for a party of 7. Since a few of us busy mommas were tricking in after work and whatnot we knew that arriving early and managing the reservation would be left to one dear friend at 7pm sharp to get things going. Having her arrive early we had her order family style appetizers, entrees and plenty of wine for when we all trickled in between 7:00-7:20pm all of us seated and drinking and eating shortly afterwards by 7pm. The "manager" who was also the host gave her a harrrrrdd time.. he kept saying he would rather not seat us until our entire party arrived. We thought that seemed odd if we were preordering food, so we asked him why.... his response: He said that he would rather give our table to someone else that walked in or split it in two vs. letting us order the food in advance in case they were able to flip a table or two in-between. Maybe someone can enlighten me if they are in the FB industry as to why this is an issue, if you are please feel free to educate me on why this should even be talked about to a guest. Also, what guarantees that these people would want to leave in order for us to be seated once everyone arrived? Anyhow, we weren't understanding the problem. Food and wine were being ordered and our party would simply sit down and start to eat and chat. The manager said, "Well if you promise to leave by 9pm as we have another reservation after yours, we can seat you now"? Huh. Okay... We promise. Whhhhhaaaa????  Our actual server was great educated on the menu, kind, and made fabulous suggestions. But we couldn't help but feel that "weird feeling" like we weren't wanted... Anyhow, long story short, The owner happened to stop by our table randomly to ask if there was anything we needed, and there was, we ordered another round of wine bottles for the table, cocktails, a couple of side sauces and another round of family style entrees, because he asked and we were having a nice time catching up. He couldn't have been more rude... or awkward maybe? He said... My name is Everette, I don't respond to being called over, snapped at or talked to across the way just so you know... and this is the only time I will be stopping by your table so if you want something order it now because I'm not coming back and its not even my job its your servers I was just stopping by to see if there was anything you needed.... um what?. We didn't know what he was talking about and thought that he was some awkward person that maybe hasn't ever really talked to a group of women before and figured he just needed something to say. So we kept the wine and convo's going catching up with each other over yummy food and kind of blew it off. Anyway, he wasn't going to ruin our night some of us mums hadn't seen each other all year so Everett and his issues with women weren't the first things on our minds.   Then 9pm hit.... Dun Dun Dunnnn..... The server dropped the check we all paid, and you guessed it, Everett came by. After we signed our ticket he started reaching across grabbing our half empty wine glasses and plates with bites of food on them still yet to be savored. Not grabbing from the side reaching his chubby flanneled arm over our faces and grabbing the dishes away on a dirty servers tray. So at that time we left. And here we are Yelp. Yelp is so cool for crap exactly like this.   Too bad. Glia Bann is like a hot pop star with a diva attitude, that eventually not one can stand... except for maybe a one night food stand, but poor Glia is not someone you take home to meet your parents, or take your loved ones to enjoy. You can get great tasting thai food with amazing hospitably elsewhere. Not a long term thing here... unless that's your thing.

m6lxP77gHlci5xltBo-Sqg.text: For the record, I'm used to Thai places like Thai Basil - very traditional but still delicious. So eating at Glai Baan was a True treat! It's a small place so don't be surprised if you have to wait -- I promise it's worth it. I had to Melon Fizz drink and it was very refreshing. Next up was the pork dumplings and my god, I could've had 3 orders of those. They are seriously addicting! Our server, Everett, was incredibly accommodating and suggested a few options, including the Panang Curry. WOW. I could've swam in that sauce it was so freaking good. It's spicy and has overall delicious flavor. I seriously can't wait to go back.

yzot98oq0ovNlDRzudJwRg.text: Very casual, truly extraordinary Thai food. This is a relaxed place. The menu isn't large, and mostly consists of small plates - many the kind of Thai salads you would see all over Bangkok. They're spicy, tasty, complex, and absolutely fantastic.  The rest of the menu is mostly noodles and a couple of stir-frys. Everything we had was interesting, authentic, and delicious. The servers respond to a request for genuine spice with genuine spice.  Probably one of the best Thai restaurants we have been to in the United States. We'd come back in a heartbeat.

yP9keT-mLgXDLbW79m6IdA.text: It was a wonderful night watching how effortless everyone seem to take care of guest. The service never missed a beat and we were never neglected. The drinks and especially the food was amazing. Though it literally was a full house, it never diminished our experience.

huTlBfaD4dAXOZpu5VMpYg.text: The food is delicious. The mushroom are to die for and that is saying a lot since I am not a fan of mushrooms haha. The only downside is I felt the plates were a bit small.

_FzpFVemU-7pY6GRU9juig.text: This place is beyond amazing! We came without a reservation and the place was very (understandably) busy but our wait didn't seem long at all due to Dan & the rest of the staff's incredible hospitality. Our waiter was well informed on the menu items and gave us great suggestions. We had the sun in law eggs and the pork dumplings, both are an absolute must for first timers. Food and atmosphere was very authentic & I left feeling like I didn't even know what I was missing! I'm so happy to have found this gem in my neighborhood. Will definitely be back.

VAPlSd2TEjabNlq6wM18fQ.text: Quite possibly my new favorite place.  Hands down great experience that you would pass right on by and miss out on...don't let it be you.  The specials tonight were fantastic.  Green curry and rice soup if you're lucky and crispy mushroom salad!  Finish it with mango and sticky rice!!!!

Nl7gKdpsCdz-B-zyPOCjMA.text: Went early because of other Yelp reviews about waiting for a table. It was not crowded at all when we arrived a little after they opened, although it was mid week and Halloween night. We chose to sit outside on the patio. I can see how parking could be a problem on busy nights. The place next door on 24th street is presently vacant and we actually parked there because it was easier to access. We were greeted warmly and seated promptly. Staff is very friendly.  We generally order beer when we are out, and although they have a impressive drink and wine menu, their beer list is rather short. They did have a couple of local brews however, and we found one we liked, Huss Copper State IPA . Drinks run in the $10 range and the beers were $5. I believe the beers are from cans or bottles as it appeared to be a 12 oz pour in our pint glasses. We normally split at Thai restaurants due to large portions, so we ordered the Kanom jeeb from the small plate menu ( pork dumplings ) and the Kapro gai kai dao from the large plate menu. Both were delicious! The dumplings were on the mild side, spicey heat wise. The Kapro provided much more heat, but not so much as to interfere with the awesome combination of spices. Our entree was definitely on the small side portion wise, but so delicious. It was enough for the 2 of us in combination with the dumplings.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai for Judy&#39;s 55th b day.

DV_k4D6LW_k-TTCZPfSNFw.text: It started with genuinely nice host and hostess at the crowded door. The drinks came quickly as well as the food. Beef Parang curry like none I have ever had; it was excellent!  The service was good. The parking lot a tad tight. But we will definitely return. It was very good.

j-AIHDA6KvduTc3i7RzsSQ.text: I would have given this 4 stars but our service was not great. I enjoyed the papaya salad, we ordered it with some sticky rice and it was pretty good. I ordered the kao soi and I thought it was perfectly spiced and very creamy. The curry flavor wasn't over powering but you do have to like curry to enjoy this dish. The noodles were really nicely cooked and I enjoyed the chicken even though I'm usually not a fan of it. They will NOT customize anything on the menu. My friend is a vegan and she asked for tofu and no egg for her noodle dish. The server made a pretty big deal about it and was rude in the process. He then kept trying to get her to eat things with animal products. He said he would only customize for food allergies and eventually said he would make her the noodles with tofu and no egg. Then the noodles came out with egg in it. They were delicious but the service is pretty lacking. I understand not being able to customize orders but to say you'll do it and then bring the food out with egg in it is annoying. He wasn't very friendly about it either. Parking is scarce and if you sit inside it's pretty loud. The outdoor seating is cute but it's getting hotter outside so it won't be enjoyable for too much longer. I would recommend trying this place.

ZClAw8MtKmmAGFFnGhB_Rw.text: Absolutely the best Asian food in Phx. Dumplings, curry braised beef and shrimp were amazing. Cocktails were also fantastic.

m5m4GYu3bkqwtize56G-xw.text: Really really solid Thai Food. We have tried several different options in the Phoenix area--all too sweet. We have tried just about everything on the menu and have enjoyed it all. Our favorites are crab fried rice, mackerel fried rice, beef short rib curry, steamed dumplings. The noodles dishes are consistent and delicious too. We have eaten in the restaurant--which is a small but charming place--and gotten take out. Service is great and food is impressive!

1tmrTL9UCqCQxsRNEgyumQ.text: 5 stars for food, 5 stars for Everett (our waiter), 5 stars for atmosphere, and 2 stars for parking (it's always a bummer when an awesome restaurant has such limited parking!) Everett may have been the most informative waiter we've ever had, he walked us through drinks, tapas, and entree options and broken it down to best seafood option, vegan option, and meat options. He also recommended a few non-menu items: fyi the oyster mushrooms were absolutely mind blowing. The mussels were another stellar recommendation and he even brought out a steaming bowl of white rice when we were 80% done so that we could soak up the delicious broth - how awesome is that! I thoroughly enjoyed the glass noodles as well; they were perfectly flavored and didn't have an overly oily sauce. Our split entree was the pad kee mao with shrimp. The shrimp were big and plump and delicious! I highly recommend pairing your dishes with the yuzu beer and old-fashioned cocktail. We'll be back!

Z_ql7pX-clPS7kb--ht_OA.text: Delicious food. Cozy space and fun friendly staff.  Gets pretty busy so recommend planning ahead and get started early.  I always like getting the Morning Glory dish.  And the buckets of booze is fun too :)

yRghL7N03HnCjxSe3Sv0aA.text: Glai Baan, I love you. Can I just say that? Is it too soon? I know we've only met once, but when you know, you know. You know?   You get me. You excite me. You are my new favorite hang. And you really hit the spot (know what I'm saying). You bring me such joy. I want nothing but success for you. Just not too much success, because I get jealous easily. No matter how popular you get, I want us to stay the same. I always wanna be your regular, baby. I wanna slip in for nightcaps. I wanna explore all the offerings on your menu. I wanna put your dumplings in my mouth.   Ok, I'm done.  Just go, but remember I was here first and you never forget your first.   (Ok, I might not have been first, but I was the best.)

Bz_AOqV5_3HN2AeexRyTYw.text: Definitely get there early for a shorter wait as they only do reservations for parties of 5+ and parking can be a little difficult. But aside from that the service, the drinks, and especially the food are all worth it! The dumplings are absolutely delicious, not to mention the desert. Left the place feeling 100% satisfied without that "stuffed" feeling we can get after eating. I'm definitely coming back again to try other menu items!

pVUjEVpf4ndZACtvedUWYQ.text: I enjoyed dinner at Glai Baan twice within a week or so, it's that good. I love seeing new and creative restaurants opening in the valley.  Glad Baan offers a unique take on Thai food that's totally new to Phoenix. Their menu is super shareable, and I am obsessed with all of their apps. The fried chicken wings are incredible, and we also loved the mussels. All of their sauces are fresh and packed with flavor.  So far, I've tried the wings, dumplings, mussels, Kao Soi, Pad Thai, and Pad Kee Mao.  Their Pad Thai is amazing. There's no other way to put it. The flavor is so rich, and so fresh. You can tell that every single dish is made with a lot of care and attention. The Kao Soi is like a curry soup that we all really enjoyed. The Pad Kee Mao was a favorite for some of our group, and fell flat for others.  Overall, definitely come here open-minded. If you're vegetarian, ask what they can do - we went the 2nd time with vegetarian friends, and the kitchen had a few specials for them.  Otherwise, try the wings, mussels, and pad thai - to start. Or just order one of everything  Their menu will continuously change, so if you love something, order it while you can!  Also, the staff was great. Dan (the owner) really cares about his patrons, and it shows.

4OT94GYZDmIWBs6WA2XgCw.text: This is such a wonderful place for not just food but for drinks as well.  This time we opted to come a little early (yeah before they open) as the last time we were here we waited for a table for 40 min (which is still worth the wait so don't let that ever stop you from coming here). The kitchen we were told was ran by the grandma or at least some of her recipes they are whipping up.  Because we were the first in line (really only come 15 min early) we chose to sit at the bar where Max the tender was not only well versed on the menu, all of the cocktails on the menu were created by him. I am not a huge sweet drink guy but he made me something with a splash of coke served with pork rinds and a jalapeno (on the side - see pic) that was a perfect way to start the evening.  We ordered the dumplings and pork skewers both of which are a great way to start and splitting as well. We followed that up with some pad thai medium. The pad thai was a little spicy for my wife but it was spot on as far as Thai medium should go. She is just a spicy lightweight so wanted to mention that for those that are as well.  I call this place a taste bud explosion for your mouth... insanely good.  At the end Max made me a simple liquor only drink and sadly don't recall the name so will need to go back just so I can have another.  Highly recommend this restaurant and we definitely will be back!

hAFP4iX3swUKH780FVXHEA.text: By far the best Thai food in Phoenix! We have been here a few times and always loved the food and drinks! This last time we tried green curry with shrimp and glass noodles with shrimp and of course they were phenomenal, even though green curry was more on a spicy side. Temple T cocktail was excellent! We are lucky we live 5 mins away! Can't wait to go there again!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Glass noodles with shrimp. So good!!!
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green curry with shrimp. Yummy!!!!

2vyZBm52CEJ9PacDR2Q6Yw.text: After reading all the great reviews I had to check this place out. I would have given this place a five star if the service had been quicker. Be prepared to have a wait. The restaurant is tiny so there's not much seating. I was okay with our 25-30 minute wait to be seated. We checked out the Rewind bar next door. Since we had waited we already knew what we wanted and were ready to order immediately after being seated. It took 40+ minutes to actually get our food. Don't come here if you are borderline hangry! The food itself was good. Nothing over the top amazing to me. But maybe because I already have a go-to Thai place. It's a cute atmosphere for sure and the owner? Seemed to be very pleasant as well as the servers. I might find myself here again but not any time soon.

GPtf2w3Vww9jydjAhJ8a-g.text: Excellent food, excellent service, excellent value - what more can you ask for?  Great find. Highly recommended

dHMTSRSCahMnTtYDgDkRTw.text: OMIGAGA!!! So delicious!   Got green papaya & crab salad, mussels, braised beef curry, mango & sweet sticky rice, & Thai tea & it was ALL delicious!!!   I'm full, but I want more! HAHAHAHA

XBoRuyIcFh7EUJ5eCj0C5w.text: Best Thai food in Phoenix. Simple as that. Super authentic. Having spent some time in Thailand, this is the most authentic Thai food I've had in Arizona.

qoUqo2Skrd4LkrmS5ZeQZA.text: I like Thai food but this place is totally different, the food is great,  they have their  own distinctive flavor,' pared with original cocktails and I was surprised to find they serve Mezcal the traditional way.

dCbsz0X0tv1uOikekVbAEQ.text: If you love Thai food, you need to come here. The food is some of the best Thai I have ever had. Extremely authentic.  I had the special, Raw Shrimp with Spicy sauce. It was spicy, clean and extremely well balanced. The Khao Soi is one of the most flavorful I have ever had. The Panang Curry with Braised short rib is absolutely amazing. The Papaya Salad is perfection. Every dish is balanced, well seasoned and memorable. You will not be disappointment. I have had a lot of Thai food and this is some of the best in the US and by far the BEST in Arizona.   Finally, the staff is wonderful. You can tell everyone here loves their job which is an sign of great management. The bartender, Max makes for great conversation and top notch drinks. Best vodka soda I have every had.

F7esY4t1rM_fulCgarI7XQ.text: This Thai place is AMAZING! I loved everything about this place! The decor was cute and brilliant, the Panang and the Pork Skewers were delightful! Definitely one of the best Thai places in the valley and I have been to MANY! There food is a little different than other Thai Food places, definitely very flavorful! I will definitely be coming back for more! The staff were awesome and friendly as well! Overall

mHrzelx_xzWiEbX69U1_3A.text: Super cute place for unexpected street thai food in PHX.  Smaller menu than expected and very heavy on meat.  However, when I told the waiter I mainly eat fish or prefer vegetarian dishes he was able to drill down to menu items where the protein was interchangeable.    Small list of craft cocktails and decent wine selection were perfect for pairing with the spicy selections The back patio felt like a friend's backyard.  It lived up to the hype from magazine write ups!  Glad we checked this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the tasty craft cocktail selections and the festive outdoor tablecloths.

HIg9cJ3RBOl8eJEmjVg6FA.text: Selfishly, i don't want to review glai baan because I want to keep it under wraps. This is an unbelievable gem of a restaurant. Authentic street food with awesome service and delightful cocktails. Dumplings are a can't-miss

Zegxfgn-dAYvmJwp9Gd_nw.text: Such a cute place! Its so nicely decorated inside that i wouldve been okay if the food was not authentic or mind blowing. BUT, wow. Food was way better than expected! I was a firm believer that Thai food should be affordable, and hefty in fheir portion sizes. But this place was the first to break my belief.  Papaya salad with Pork belly was great. Nice heat to it, but not "cut my tongue off!!!" spicy. Dumplings were yummy, and the sauce that it came with was A+. Pad kee mao was one of the best I've had. I did level 6 on spicy, and asked for a hot sauce on the side. Our server brought out fish sauce with peppers in it. So good.  Dessert, we had the bread with custard and it was unique! Nothimg crazy or exotic, but it was a must try.  Everett (i think was his name) was amazing. Coming from restaurant industry myself, he was def someone i would love to work with! Will definitely be returning :) i want to try everything on the menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad kee mao and the fish pepper sauce !!
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Laab cocktail! Must try!
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papaya salad with pork belly. So good. Nice heat.

I_MLFKbh9gwcM0ufT3ORKg.text: Yummy food and a cute atmosphere! Came here last night and it was relatively busy. I loved all of the plants outside, and inside was cool too. It's a little small but wasn't too overly crowded or anything!  The manager (I think) stopped and talked to us, he was really nice and informative. Our server was too! We started off with these chive rice cubes that were fried and served with a spicy soy sauce. We liked the sauce but the rice cubes were pretty bland. Bland is not what I expect from a Thai place, but they still tasted good. I didn't see tofu on the menu, but I asked and they said they had tofu and I could substitute tofu for any meat dish! I ended up getting the kao soi with tofu. It was pretty tasty and a large portion! I would certainly order it again, though it lacked a little spice so maybe I'd have to say something about that next time. The menu made it seem like their food would be spicy, but everything seemed a little mild to me, and I'm usually sensitive to spice. We also got the steamed white bread with custard for dessert, I hadn't even heard of it before but it was sooo good! This place is a bit pricey but good quality stuff, worth it. I'd come back her for sure.

Q6AZueUToQUJy2Wx7KRtNg.text: 2nd time around: the service is still great. The entree quantity has gone down, a dish that we had shared last year, is now barely enough for one person. Also, our appetizer and entree had a small puddle of oil. I have never seen oil on my plate when I have eaten Thai food(from past 20 years). We had ordered krapao and pad kee mao both are stir fried and shouldn't be that oily.  The overall taste is still good.

Z3ZlKrhM7QxNwlh-OMniuQ.text: Glai Baan has fantastic service. Our server was very friendly. Our water cups were never empty and our used plates were removed quickly. I personally don't feel their prices are high because they claim to use higher quality meat and seafood. The inside dining area can get pretty loud. We arrived a few minutes before they open and people were waiting in their cars. The restaurant filled up quickly. We started with the dumplings and wings. My husband thought both apps were good. I ordered the Pad Thai and I have had better. Hubby ordered the Kapro gai kai dao (minced chicken). He thought it was fantastic as the sweat appeared on his face. He enjoyed it! We also shared the Crab Fried Rice. I thought it was very good where as hubby thought it was very salty. We both had Thai tea. Parking lot is small and can be difficult while others are trying to get your spot while leaving.  I cook a variety of Thai curry and noodles so I don't think we will return unless we are back in the city and want to try other dishes.

AIwx6toe7QkoVc755x-cSA.text: Incredibly authentic Thai flavors. The bartender Max really was welcoming and a great navigator of the menu. Everything was excellent- really liked the sticky rice, green curry ( daily special) and beef item that was awesome. So glad we discovered this amazing place!! Super yummy!!!

AJrTDkie9nPiCe6QPS5UnA.text: Best Thai! So much variety and everything is Delish!  Love the patio and great service. Always busy because it's so darn good. Love the intimidate bar!

7I_Nh5ksPI3FJTDKDpvf1w.text: As far as Thai food this has been my favorite place by far!  Atmosphere is cute and simple, a tiny house that has small indoor and outside seating. Family pictures on the wall cute simple decor.  The food is outstanding we tried four different foods and each was unique and fabulous. To start we had the steamed dumplings, omg these were so tasty and full nice flavor I could have ordered more. Then the Somtum thai salad that was really refreshing and simple. Then I got a special for the day which was deep fried mushrooms which is called the mushroom salad and it was so good, the mushrooms where huge. Then we finished with the pad Thai with chicken and all I have to say is it is the best ever! The chicken was cooked perfect and the sauce was absolutely fantastic.  The waiters are so nice and friendly and go above and beyond! The drinks are worth the try I stuck with the melon patch fizz and I don't know if I would ever order anything else it was that good.
