NapjuiuLxAeBJ8w-6OPFww.text: Really great Tai!  Staff very nice!  Fun place to go!  I would give them 5 stars but the wait is always long. 45 min on average

I0qdtDRO9Au8L8jSRpTd4g.text: Quaint little place that will sneak up on you, just West of 24th street and Osborn. I was hesitant, because boutique Thai isn't on my radar. My wife suggested, so we went right at opening on a Friday night. We were greeted by friendly folks and promptly seated. The crowds started getting legit around 6pm. Food was good and man was it hot. I don't really know the names of the dishes, but we started with the pork dumplings. My wife has some hotter than h$ll dish which she liked, while I had some special with glass noodles and shrimp. It was really good, and so-so hot. This is a great vine type of place with great service one would expect. I am anxious to go back and try the other dishes. Patio seating in the early fall and spring would be amazing here, which they do have. Parking is tricky, so be patient.

dgFt5pIsDj7i_xuMPL8jog.text: This place has a lot of potential but there are some kinks that need to be ironed out. I'm not sure if Friday nights are normally as busy but it was a packed house. So we did have to wait 25 minutes for a table (which I never have a problem with.)   Since we had a bit of a wait, I went up to the bar to get us some drinks. The bartender told me I wasn't allowed to order drinks from the bar on my own and that our server has to get the drinks. I told him that we haven't been seated yet and would like a drink while we wait. He again told me I could not order and told me to go back to the waiting area and he would come out to get my drink order. Aside from that being a rather odd rule that customers can't order drinks from the bar, he never came out to get our drink order as he said he would. So right away that left a bad impression before even being seated.  Once seated, our server was nice but seemed very distracted. Most of the time as we were speaking to him, he'd be looking off in other directions as if he had somewhere else to be. He wasn't very social and almost seemed uncomfortable.   Service was slow but I do understand that since it was a busy night so let's get to the food itself. We ordered Pot Stickers and Asian Wings as appetizers. The Pot Stickers were the best I've had and absolutely worth ordering. The wings, not so much. They were so over deep fried that there was a burnt taste to them that even the sauce couldn't cover up. However, the main dishes were all very good. I had a chicken curry noodle soup dish (Kao Soi) and it was by far the most flavorful noodle dish I've ever tasted. It wasn't overwhelmingly spicy and had the perfect amount of substance. My friend had the Pad Thai, which was good and my husband had a noodle and rice dish that was also very flavorful.   Overall, the food is good and worth trying if you like authentic Thai cuisine. The strange rule from the bartender of not being able to order drinks while waiting 25 minutes for a seat is rather odd and I hope isn't a normal rule.

BUwyOIYqqS0wT12vsBeZnA.text: Glai Baan has managed to push all the other Thai restaurants I like down a slot and claim first place with me. I like that they offer items you can't get at other Thai eateries. Their specialty is Thai street food but they have things like pad Thai for the more vanilla taste buds.  My favorite item has to be those darn pork dumplings. They are very similar to the xiao long bao you can get at Chinese soup dumpling restaurants. They were so flavorful, so tender that my party and I ordered another plate of them. I also had the very aromatic Thai sausage. We did order pad Thai which was very tasty. I also had the son-in-law eggs, which are boiled and fried. They were good but I don't think I would pay money for just ONE egg.  The ambience is really like every other Thai restaurant in Phoenix. Pictures of the king (RIP), simple wooden chairs and tables and loud table cloths for the patio. Anyway, with the way they cook, I don't care what the decor is. Looking forward to a return visit!

UO0UcgTFlk_CJK4fKnP2lw.text: This place is amazing! The food is ridiculously good and it has a cool atmosphere. They also have gluten free options. We are definitely going to go back soon!

D6brGd2RlcWHuTXv-ynfDA.text: Great place - fun twist on fairly authentic Thai food !   Bring a group of 4+ so you can try a variety of things.   Hot is not as hot as that make it seem! Go for it.   Get the "beef" yess beef not beet salad! Drink some drinks eat the food, fall in love.

a1QVEyiIywIlnXxOYhzg2w.text: Loved this place and I don't even like Thai food that much...I guess that's because I've never had good Thai food before (until now)! First of all the ambiance is great, very intimate and cozy. I'm pregnant so I couldn't partake in any of their cocktails but they looked great and I'm excited to try them someday! Had the pork dumplings to start, pad Thai with shrimp for entree and mango sticky rice for dessert (definitely don't skip this dish). All were fresh and so delicious! Will definitely be back!

Hc_xVEAF0OM7t4mAIHOmlw.text: My experience here was one for books. I was thinking I would have to wait a long time as I hadn't made a reservation and was waiting for a friend to join me for dinner. The first person I met when I walked in the door was Dan, one of the owners of this jewel of a spot who offered to seat me immediately. Unfortunately, my friend hadn't arrived yet but Dan said not to worry he would take care of us as soon as the party was complete. I'm thinking that meant a long wait as the place was jammed and there were people waiting outside. My friend arrived shortly and True to his word, Dan sat us immediately. The food was superb. Tom yum moo soup was tasty as could be and my Pad Prik king was great... extra spicy as requested. Their wine list matches well with the dishes and is reasonably priced as are the food choices. All in all, a great choice.

JD7FpQp562C3fPmfvc7D5Q.text: food was delicious and worth the wait. All the small plates! that's the way to go. Get there early because lines form and you're looking at an hour + wait to get seated. But its worth it.

Gk-o2HBR5ZKiiyRR1eyotQ.text: What a rare find in Phoenix! The dumplings were super delish! The pad kee mao was really authentic!  We sat outdoors and enjoyed our evening here so much. I highly recommend this place. There are very few places like this in Phoenix. I hope they stay consistent!

FnHSb9Za_P1nHWShkWUX6g.text: We saw the review in the local paper and decided to try it out. We just moved back to the states from spending a couple of years in Vietnam and my wife is a Vietnamese food blogger and cookbook author so we've got some appreciation of SE Asian food. We've also spent quite a bit of time in Thailand solely to eat.  First the good: 1. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice and there is a charming outdoor seating area. 2. Someone there really loves Doraemon, the robot cat from the future who is also very popular all over SE Asia but is probably unknown by most in the West. Cute touch. 3. The serving staff is ultra-attentive and kind. I'm giving 4 stars for them, otherwise it would be 3. 4. The flavor of my pork belly dish was really good, with a nice smoky aroma. 5. Back to the servers, they topped my water off religiously. Cheers to them! 6. Nice bathrooms. Clean and well-designed. 7. Good parking and street access  Now the bad: 1. As others have noted we paid more for Pad Thai than I have paid anywhere, including NYC, and the portion size will leave you still hungry at the end. This was True for my 95lb wife who is not a big eater by any means. My meal was similar in size and left me needing something more, although not at the prices this place charges. Either the portions need to increase or the price needs to decrease for this to feel like a reasonable deal.  2. The Pad Thai was just ok, and it included uncooked white scallions, which is a no-no. They should have used cooked chives. It was also missing tamarind sauce and the noodles were undercooked for legit Thai noodles and the vegetables were also undercooked and too hard for Pad Thai. It wasn't terrible but a standard $2 plate of real Pad Thai street food would have been a better standard to base their recipe on.  Also, for Asian tastes it was very over-salted, which is unfortunately the standard for Asian food in Phoenix.  3. There were some interesting-looking small plates on the menu but at a high enough price that I wasn't interested enough to try one out.  4. The restaurant was moderately busy on a Thursday night, most indoor tables filled, but no diners waiting to be seated. We were told that they wouldn't be filling our food order for at least 40 minutes since the kitchen was so slammed. Having worked both front of house and back of house in popular restaurants, I would say this is pretty unacceptable level of performance for their kitchen. This will lose the restaurant money as people decide to leave (as we saw a couple of couples do) instead of wait so long for their food. We had to wait 40-50 minutes for our food. Real Thai food tends to come out quick, fresh and hot so I'm not sure why their cooks aren't up to the task to keep their kitchen humming along.  I think this place has potential, particularly with the great staff and building. Thai street food isn't difficult to prepare, so they just need to make some adjustments to reach the level of deliciousness that you can get on any street or even in the Central World mall food court in Bangkok. They also need to either add kitchen staff or get their staff trained in managing multiple orders at once and get an expediter or someone to help keep things running quicker in the back.

e_go10_k3ULTkVV_LNH7nA.text: The food is good but not good enough for the price. Simple dishes are over priced. I really wanted to love this spot since it is in the neighborhood but it comes up short compared to other local Thai restaurants. The staff seemed nice and attentive so I give them 5 stars.

gyTmC-Y84QbfDRDczA45tQ.text: I stopped by tonight for takeout and sampled a bunch of menu items: son in law eggs (deep fried soft-boiled with nuom choc), beef panang, pad Thai, papaya salad, and sausage with pepper relish. Everything was so delicious and a refreshing change from every other Thai place around.   The patio and dining room are lovely. The service was excellent. The bar is stocked and the people next to me were raving about their drinks.   Can't wait to go back!  Editing to add I am finishing off my leftover Panang for lunch and I am so sad I don't have more. This place is a gem!

d1R5lZ2m_TBPETGWAqGLxQ.text: Delicious authentic Thai Food! The experience was fantastic. The servers were very attentive and helpful with recommendations on the menu. The menu was short but had a variety of dishes. I would definitely recommend the dumplings and the Pad Thai was delicious! We also met the owner of the restaurant who was very friendly and made sure we had a great experience. Will definitely go back!

_XZyUH-cl1o8iYYzzmyM4w.text: This was my choice for my birthday dinner, was here on 10/20.  This restaurant has only been open a few weeks. The whole evening was great. The vibe and decor is cozy and warm. 2 of my favorite things were the saloon doors that led to the restrooms and the wrought iron door that led to the patio. I really wanted to take a lot more pictures of the interior of the restaurant but I didn't want to be rude. I liked how repurposed furniture was used to store utensils, napkins, etc. Water was served in tin cups. We sat on the back patio which was decorated with trees that were lit up. There were benches for sitting and chatting. The food was outstanding, if you closed your eyes, you would've thought you were in Thailand. We sampled many dishes but the sea bass was my favorite, flavorful and crisp. Food arrived quickly, and the servers were attentive. Since I am a girlie girl, I have to talk about the restrooms lol. There are 2 restrooms, very clean and also gender neutral. I'll never understand why more restaurants don't have gender neutral restrooms! My only suggestion would be to have some sort of changing station for patrons who have infants or young children. I highly recommend Glai Baan as it is a perfect place for date night, families, friends, celebrations. We drove from Surprise and it was so worth it.  Will definitely be back

koCgYyl-m7pvjQR4e18d7Q.text: 4 star newcomer. Great food, super friendly owner, fun nostalgic Thai pictures from owners on the walls. Good date night spot! The food was exactly what I would envision getting from a yum food truck or street vendor in Thailand! A very different experience from your run of the mill Thai restaurant.

86ueNJXuJgILpFfcOx_39Q.text: I think I was here on an off night. My friend and I went tonight on Thursday. They were bustling but seated us immediately with water and a drink order. Then seemed to forget one friends drink after several reminders we got it at the back third of the meal. We also had to ask for plates and a few other things multiple times as they seemed to be forgotten.  The food was delicious, the dumplings are delicious the larb was tasty. I didn't not enjoy the crab salad. Mostly bc it seemed like there was no crab flavor and only hard shell crab which was occasionally smaller than other pieces of the papaya salad and were almost eaten or swallowed.   If I come back I'll likely order takeout.

0ATOQ1qMZ6q2ss7-9PYPhw.text: Great discovery. Authentic Thai street food. Amazingly flavorful dishes. Excellent service. The Tom zap soup is now my go to soup!

OJhd0a6AVSzk9H9sXH2_Yg.text: This is the BEST Thai place in Phoenix. They specialize in Thai street food, a small menu of around 16 items and it is divine. I read a review that said there was bad service, but I did not experience that at all, the service was consistent, polite and they even told us where they sourced their dishes from. The ambiance was homey, and very authentic.

1IvRZ0fRZg2m6Y9A-OWyzw.text: Such a hip little spot. Love the charming interiors and patio. The food is delicious. The staff was the most memorable as they were so incredibly kind and generous!! So lovely!

Jl9scz2m87bwgOdvEr-G1w.text: Excellent 'street Thai food'.  It's really just a sit down restaurant, but the food is good.

Lz9bt7kV3mn2PVVuZAciZw.text: The pork dumplings we're really good. Papaya salad was also good. But we didn't listen and o our waitress and we got it with fried port belly instead of crab. I thought I would break a trip other so I didn't eat it. Wine options were actually very well done to work with the spices   No t as impressed as the locals. Could b we have better options

qog-zoCVzCYTreilHxJAFA.text: The best classic Thai snacks !   We are Thai and Thai people know how good Thai foods be tasted like ! Snacks and dishes are fabulous ! Cocktails are great great! Very nice and cosy atmosphere that I enjoyed every dishes and their special menus ! My family and friends were very happy .    We love this place very much !

Fcxk-ZPNWkHUsv4e17318w.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. EVERYTHING, literally, everything is good. It's very difficult for us to not order everything off the menu when we go. Amazing drinks - especially the Laab Sided. You can't go wrong with any of the food. Truly unique flavors that are always so well balanced and pack a punch. The chef is incredible talented and I can't stress how truly magical the food is! The only downfall is they are always always busy. Even if you go when they open, you might have to wait.

U5g536L4sZ8mcUQNrAz7vA.text: The pork dumplings are the best I've ever tried. Seriously can't stop thinking about them.  I would get 2 orders of them next time.  Run, don't walk to this amazing Thai restaurant.  I used to live in Thailand and am thrilled to be able to find some of my favorites right here in Phoenix.  The sticky rice with mango was delicious, sweet gooey and coconutty.  And the pad thai was good.  The service is excellent, my cup of water was always filled and the thai tea is delicious, ordered a 2nd.  And the chef personally came out to see how we liked the food, she had made everything fresh, which was reflected in the flavors of the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WbOJMtpaPUurCoblcc4Ftg.text: OK, let's start with pork dumplings   You are crazy if you don't. These balls of joy are incredible!  Not gushing with liquid like  so many, just a flavorful pouch with a little crunchiness. Absolutely the best dumplings I have had.   We did the Pad Kee Mao for an entree. Medium spicy wasn't very hot, if you like a little heat, go fo"spicy ".  Quality of the dish is top notch.   Try this place, you will love it!

nca9Fl-qoY6FroBRWgDtuA.text: This Thai is the best in the valley. The pad thai and crab fried rice are amazing and so tasty. The only complaints are the parking lot, which is a zoo and there is limited space, and the wait time. We stopped in to place the order because the phone lines were off. It took a while to get the food so I recommend trying to call ahead.

pFk1a3QddoKOaXd34ggJqg.text: I'm from Vegas and theres no thai food like this there!! This place is so gooooood! I would say it's probably one of the best Thai restaurant I've ever tried. Awesome customer service. There's always a wait but it's so worth it:)) also you can sit outside if the heat doesn't bother you.

jR41eRxdTH-J8G9CO1znaA.text: This is by far my new favorite place to dine...the atmosphere, the service, the energy and of course the food make the experience great! Knowledgeable staff who take pride in educating patrons not only the menu, but the culture as well...friendliest staff, fabulous menu, tasty food with flavors that pop with every bite...Simply an outstanding place to eat for Thai!!!

3N-Lr7HoMgd_0wyVO8PBnA.text: We really enjoyed our dinner here. The appetizers were good, I definitely recommend the son-in-law egg if you want to try something new.  The place is not very big so there were several parties waiting to be seated when we left around 7 pm on Friday evening.

jaSoLdoYGVzwmoxyVBBIug.text: Awesome high end Thai food!! I've spent a summer in South East Asia and I felt like this place took me back. I loved the ambience, but the restaurant is super small. Be prepared to wait or make a reservation.

vwyXtGMfAOOGs5Kj0NVbWQ.text: Here for short business trip.. Every one was super Friendly along with excellent services. Cute little place with Great tasting food.

Awesome atmosphere. Must get the dumplings and wings. Honestly cannot recommend this place enough. If you're looking for Thai food, look no further!

bDKMes5kwj0tQsQtghrekA.text: needed some late night grub/takeout and discovered this late night gem . sat in bar and placed a to go order . waiter recommended the  Pad Kee Mao , as i wanted something w noodles in it .easily one of the best Thai dishes i have ever had as well as their delicious thai tea ..only negative i would say is their portion was rather small for the $$ ( not sure if it was because i got it to go) but either way,very filling!  will def be back

mMlCw0ZY9rYTqZuZj92Amw.text: Best Thai in Arizona hands down! Best wings in Phoenix, great potstickers, it's all good!

oD7AfIjEay47rpRimobgtQ.text: Will definitely be back for the amazing hospitality! Everyone was so warm and friendly. Food was really good too.

KLqpiZTP0f01b4oggSPucQ.text: Got here soon after opening. Parking was great. Host was amazing and very attentive and caring. Took a while to be seated but we had a large party. Host was again fantastic showing me how to use the baby high chair and alerting me of possible hazards on the patio. The Host's performance set up a great night for us, very welcoming and hospitable. I think it was just an off night here because the drinks were great, the food was fantastic, but the food took Forever to come out. Food came out very sporadically and the very last dish was for one of our friends who was unfortunately the last one to eat, came out two hours after we were seated. The rest of us felt bad for eating before him, but he insisted and we were starving with a baby in tow. When he finally got his food, he had to scarf it down because everybody else at the table was just sitting there. Sucky position for him to be put in. We were in a festive mood so all was well. Food was great. I will definitely give this place another try. Host and staff was awesome and service like that makes you want to come back. Like I said, off night.

D3Kmgpgf_fWmom6hYBY41w.text: I came to this place tonight with my boyfriend and one of our bestfriends. And man!!! I am surprised this place hasn't received an overall 5-star yet!!! It's a perfect go to place for every one!! The interior is very beautiful, AWESOME customer service, and very delicious food!!! They make you feel valued and they check to make sure that you're enjoying your experience!! I would highly recommend this place to my friends and family!!! This is going to be my go to place from now on!! Just a tip, you should try the Panang Curry!! Very well spiced and very tender beef!! Thank you so much for your awesome service Glai Baan!! It's worth the drive coming from Coolidge, AZ!!!

baBv3d_kpZxHYOZrkjXJ0w.text: YES! Was here not too long ago, also it's been years since I wrote a Yelp review  this place is one of its only exceptions.  As a person who moved here to Phoenix not too long ago, Since moving here, ive yearned for authentic south East Asian cuisine here in the valley (being from Khmer, Thai, and Chinese decent)   I'm happy to say Glai Baan is doing something right, they're not doing what Phoenix wants. They're feeding Phoenix something they never knew they needed.   From dishes as like Khao soi, Pad kee mao, nam phrik, aren't really found her in Phoenix, possibly due to the major amounts of dumbed down Asian menu's to fit the cities palate.   Glai baan has become a beacon of light for Phoenix's food scene, something I been patiently waiting to see for this city. This place is somewhere I feel like I can invite my friends of any racial decent into my grandmothers home without the feeling of hopefully not chasing them out with the smell of fermented fish hanging in the air. Instead; excited for them to taste the roots of our ancestors without having to change the food.   Thank you Glai baan, you've made me proud and happy to be here in Phoenix.

T3JcENJC56lJuqLEMzVPEA.text: I love this place. I went to Thailand at the end of 2017 and this place took me back.  Authentic Thai food from the northern region. I was part of a party of 4 and when we ordered only 2 of the 4 meals came, but the chef was so kind and came out to apologize for the long wait for the other 2 food to come out and comped the 2 meals. The staff are so friendly. The Phuket Bucket cocktail drink (for 2+ people) was good. So in summary: * Great Thai food from the Northern Region of Thailand. * Food: Kao Soi is delicious, Fried Chicken and the Jungle Curry Special * Drink: Phuket Bucket

n8JF00bJas_Xy09OzvFjpg.text: So much to love about this place- friendly staff, tasty cocktails, yummy food.  Loved the papaya salad and tom yum moo soup had great flavor and just the right amount of heat. I wouldn't have ordered the fried mushroom salad (think tempura style), but loved the herbs they were tossed with. Laab sided cocktail was fantastic!!   Can't wait to return to try the rest of the menu.

yZ02DJGuoLFihLikhSNofg.text: This place was so great! Came with a couple of friends who had been wanting to try it out for a while and I'm so happy I tagged along. The atmosphere was one of my favorite things about my experience, such a quaint space with an extremely charming patio. Be aware in the warmer months that spicy food and hot temps make it difficult to enjoy the patio. The drinks were unique/delicious and we enjoyed the clever garnishes. We ordered quite a variety of food and I was impressed with most everything, it is the closest I've had to Thai street food since I left Thailand . My favorite appetizer was the Nua num tok, New York strip, it was cooked to perfection and the flavors were amazing. We also ordered the Peek gai tod, chicken wings, they were so crispy and tender. The Somtum, papaya salad, was light, crunchy and refreshing (ordered without the pork belly for dietary restrictions of one of my friends, but I bet it would have been amazing with). Our server said that her favorite item on the menu was the chive rice cake, I didn't agree, it was cooked amazingly but I wasn't about the flavor, probably just a personal taste as my friends seemed to be into it (only dish on our table where we left some behind). The Padthai was sooo good and also very happy with the Kapro gai kai dao. I will definitely be back, thank you for the great service and delicious food!

fJQ1DoQ-1tcRSf7EtD1TFQ.text: Heard great things about this place so decided to try it for my birthday dinner. No disappointment! I can't wait to go back! I heard great things & the crowd shows it. Showed up at 6pm (only an hour after opening Saturday) & a 30 minute wait. I didn't mind--and the wait was spot on. Little restaurant with patio, probably great in the winter months. All their drinks from the bar looked beautiful. Our food was amazing. Highly recommend the dumplings & the rice, pork belly bowl (apologies for not knowing the name). The food came out quick, and was enough food to make you feel satisfied without overly full. Can't wait to show friends & family!

iivdxBhYBdmz1cx4Nwc0fQ.text: I cannot recommend this place enough!  So good. It was suggested by the hotel's bartender (Chris @TheCamby) and he was spot on. May I suggest the following dishes...Pork dumplings (wonderful flsvor and texture, so much goodness). Oyster mushrooms (wow..just wow. Simply amazing). Glass noodles (Epitome of Thai...simple huge flavor). Curry Beef (the long wait for a table is woth the experience of this dish. I will be back just because of th his dish). Go eat here.

oTUyd5l_hGQarlsXdiNtlw.text: This is the best Thai restaurant in the valley. So lucky we live close to Glai Baan. Have been here so many times and never had a bad experience.   Food: 5 Ambiance: 5 Service: 5  The dumplings, crab papaya salad and the wings are amazing. The best dish in my opinion is the panang curry. A must have every time we visit.  Service is very good and quick. The bar area is small and nice. Always a good chat when you sit at the bar.  Definitely in my top 5 restaurant list.

dZeJgs_JkU5kdE2SNgnxEg.text: Bomb!!  I got out of work late and was craving Thai food. My husband found this spot open late. Right when we walked in we were welcomed in and they made sure we knew the menu and the specials. We ordered the Kanom jeeb (pork dumplings)and they were delicious and authentic.  My husband ordered the Pattaya beach grilled chicken which was perfectly cooked and chicken was still juicy. My kid ordered chicken fried rice she said it was the best she had. She's my picky eater. I ordered the Pad Kee Mao it was absolutely amazing!  I loved that they had different (hot) sauce options. Katie was awesome making sure we had everything  we need it to make it an enjoyable dinner. The service was great and very friendly. The FOOD was BOMB but most important I have to praise the service that is what makes the ambiance pop. I would have to say this is the best Thai food in AZ!!! Will come again and tell others about this place!  Thank you Katie!!!

xx082B5beoYGF3APOSDChg.text: The best Thai food in Phoenix and it is not even close. The place packs out with a line before they even open so expect a wait if you arrive anytime after 5pm.   Of particular note, the cocktails are fantastic. Unique and so good!

JYxGT40wWgUIRoGuWHkBgw.text: We went in on a busy night with no reservation and had to wait a bit but the cocktails we ordered while waiting already had us hooked.  Each cocktail was very distinctive and the flavors were just perfectly balanced.  BY the time we sat down we were quite hungry and ordered several dishes to share. I'd tell you which was best if we hadn't loved EVERYTHING.  Really, you can't go wrong with this menu.  Great service, very nice atmosphere and food to die for.  I can't recommend this place highly enough.

4PbuT0tve6Rm-HGTju1Q5Q.text: One of my favorite Thai spots in town. Traditional Bangkok style dishes, cute atmosphere and really really tasty food & cocktails. I'm super fond of the Thai basil minced chicken, reminds me of those I had in Thailand when visiting. Also the crab fried rice is delicious as are the chicken wings and papaya salad. It's always busy in the evenings on the weekends but the wait is worth it. Takeout is always good too!

vJRtJ9LIT31_LDQg-hOghQ.text: This cozy, locally owned  restaurant will definitely be my go -to -Thai fix from now on!!   The host , who was so friendly and welcoming,  offered me a  table in the tree -filled  back patio with it's hanging lights and gentle breezes...such a  lovely ambiance!  I was dining solo but it would be perfect for date night! The service -on a filled-to-capacity weeknight  - was excellent. My waitress couldn't have been any  more  attentive . The food !! I ordered a  rice noodle plate with  crispy pork belly and veggies tossed  in a delicious sauce. I requested medium spicy and it still had quite a kick. Watch out ! You may want to order lightly spicy. If I had one suggestion  for improvement,  if it were my restaurant,  I  would install  a mister system in the patio  area in the summer months. It was very warm out there. All in all,  it was a perfect dining experience.  The best people,  epic food ! Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio

wOxh-InDxuSwgbecojBN-w.text: Glai Baan is another case of a place that I had driven past 100s of times, wanted to try, yet never made it until yesterday. It's now going to be an effort to make up for lost time because this is the best Thai place in the area, no questions asked. I had noticed that every time that I had driven by the parking lot was very full. Being that it was a Saturday we decided to be there at open and that seems like it was a good idea because the place was packed by 6.   We both got regular Thai iced teas to start (I will return for a boozy review next time - no drinking for this guy this weekend) and ordered the chicken wings and the steak strips with the micro green salad. The wings were so crispy and juicy, and I could have eaten just those for dinner with the yummy sauce. The steak strip small plate was sooooo flavorful and bright, it really brought to mind all of the Thai flavors, so yummy. We were now faced with the decision of what entree's to order after being so dazzled with the small plates.   My fiancee decided to order the pad kra pao gai and it was phenomenal. Excellent flavor and it wasn't overcooked, over salted or oily. The flavors were very complex and crisp. I went for my standby of Panang curry and it was the best panang curry I've ever had. The vegetables were delicious, the curry was perfect and I loved tossing my rice in it and the beef was delicious. Rather than being small beef strips, the beef was almost like a roast that was so tender and and flavorful.   The service was fantastic, the food was the best and we literally don't have a single complaint about this place. Well I wish it was across the street from my house and open 24/7 but I guess those are both unrealistic dreams. Lol.

XsAKENW_AJF1BbvO6A5TQQ.text: Great tasting food though small portions but terrible management of the restaurant.  Everyone is working hard, very hard, and that is commendable however it's just not smartly managed.  Tiny place with great food means great demand.  This place sadly is not equipped to handle that demand as I learned on one occasion they only have 1 wok operating in the kitchen and that causes major delays.  Also in the chaos they make mistakes every time I go there.  Actual examples being on multiple occasions I ordered two entries to only have one come out on to-go orders, while on another occasion when dining in with a friend to only have one entree come out.  When I asked the server when my entree was coming they informed me that we only ordered 1 entree even though we had definitely ordered two.  Like I would not order food at a restaurant for myself after waiting in line for and hour and fifteen minutes.  They rectified it and by the time I got the entree it was well over 2 hours from check in.  Not sure if their great food is worth this anymore, I've been here more times than I can count and it is consistently this way, and so regrettably I am moved to leave this negative review.  I'm ok going elsewhere from now on, and fingers crossed for another restaurant of like quality to pop up, competition has its way of resolving such issues.  Oh and they don't answer their phones usually, yet another example of mismanagement of the restaurant and growing frustration for their customers.  Regrettably.

bUPTdYSP5TC6jqAbMYFktQ.text: This place is incredible! Absolutely love it. Food is wonderful, the service is even better. Also open late. Hidden gem. Definitely one of my favorites! A must!

Uc_asCEanx10ZtYf_DaAIA.text: Had this place bookmarked for a while. After a few beers, my girl and I were hungry & decided to stop here for a bite since it was down the street. It was a Saturday night around dinner time. We got in just right before the dinner rush. Place seems pretty small. The entrance was a little hard to find at night. Couldn't tell if I was going through the right door or not.   We decided to order a few dishes to share together. We got the wings, moo larb (minced pork meat salad), & the pad ke mao (drunken noodles) & an order of sticky rice.   The wings came with a dipping sauce. It was good but I feel like it didnt match up with the wings that well. The wings were lightly battered and fried perfectly! They were nice & crunchy, just the way I like them. The moo larb was pretty good as well. It comes with a little wedge of cabbage. But the best dish we ate was the pad ke mao, hands down. The flavors were so on point. Perfect amount to seasoning, not overly salty. We just couldn't get enough!  Service was pretty good. The water they serve doesnt come with ice, which was a little odd. I had to keep asking for a cup of ice because I usually like to drink my water cold instead of lukewarm. I felt like it was a bit overpriced for the portion sizes they serve. The plate of moo larb was smaller than I expected it to be. And the sticky rice was extremely disappointing to me. You pay $2 for not even a handful of rice. It was like half a handful. Sticky rice isnt much more expensive than steamed rice.. felt like I was getting ripped off cuz I could have saved those $2 and made a whole batch at home instead. Also, they have a very small parking lot that is a bit hard to get out of if you park in the rear side of the building.   Overall, this place is good. I will probably return to try other dishes.

luzctxXRhvC4lZetKEZcHQ.text: OH MY GOODNESS! I finally made it in to Glai Baan and am SO happy that I did. First, the ambiance is so cozy, hip, and romantic. It does get busy on weekends so I recommend calling ahead if you have a large party! It makes the perfect date night spot or good for small groups of 4-6. The cocktails are truly unique, whipped up by a FABULOUS and well-known Valley mixologist (Hi Maxwell!). He made me the yummiest Thai Tea Mocktail that came in the cutest cup, with an adorable straw, and umbrella. Yes, please. I loved it. For all the mommas out there, have him make this for you!   For appetizers, our group of 5 people shared 3 orders (yes, THREE, they're that good) of their dumplings, one order of their fried rice with chicken, papaya salad, and their wings. Oh my goodness, everything was so flavorful but the dumplings are definitely some of the best that i've ever had.   For my entree, I ordered the Kao Soi. Think Thai Curry in a soup version with rice noodles, chicken, cilantro, herbs, etc. OH MY GOSH, obsessed. It was a HUGE portion as well. You better believe i'll be coming here on the regular during the wintertime to get a bowl of this comforting goodness. It is literally soup for the soul.  If you love Thai food, this will be your new favorite place in town. It really doesn't compare to any other Thai food that i've had in the Valley, or ever. Possibly because their menu consists of "street" Thai dishes but honestly, it is dreamy. You can thank me later. ;) We'll be back again soon, for sure!  P.S. Sorry for the lack of foodie photos! It was a tad dark and I just didn't feel that my photos did the food justice so I kept it a surprise! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Phuket Bucket
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Max whipped up this tasty mocktail for me!!! Momma is happy!

gU4hpRyP0CI6-a1BqJR78g.text: I've been here 2 times so far and I loved every single moment of it. This is in a small area and the parking is mad annoying. Honestly it's better to park at the neighboring plaza because it's a lot easier to enter and exit. The interior is small and cozy, and they also have an outdoor area. I have gone with large parties that will be sat outside and it works. The oysters and the wings are a must get there. Probably some of the best wings too. They are paired with a sauce but you may not even need it because they're good alone. The oysters are really good and the sauce that it's paired with goes great with rice. Highly recommended for anyone who wants Thai cuisine done right. I recommend making reservations because this place is small. If you are waiting chances are you are going to wait outside because of the small building.

We also shared the sticky rice dessert. I feel like I've had better sticky rice before, but this one was still really good! I want to try their pad thai and their curries. I love thai food. I would definitely come back to try more things!

erwTcRhlphlrOspahZjobQ.text: BEAT DUMPLINGS I'VE EVER HAD!!!  Amazing concept, great service and weekly specials! A hidden gem that is definitely worth going to!

ojNde2LbIg7rbhiBBhCSTQ.text: After two visits to Glai Baan, I feel confident saying that I'm a fan!  My first visit was with my husband and kids... we had a pleasant experience, but I didn't rush back right away.  After that meal, I decided that I like traditional Thai food better than the "street food" that is served here.   However, when a friend suggested we meet at Glai Baan for dinner on a recent Saturday night, I took her up on her offer as it was time for a revisit.  I'm so glad I did as I liked the food much better than the initial visit.  On both visits, I had the Pad Thai and the Chicken Wings, and on my second visit, we shared an order of Pad Prik with Chicken... all of those things were very good.  It's worth noting that the menu is a bit limited, especially for those who don't eat pork... there is a lot of pork on the menu!  That being said, there is something for most everyone here, including my kids who are pretty picky.  For picky eaters or those that aren't feeling too adventurous, ask for the rice and chicken and you'll be good.   The food is the highlight here but GB also offers a unique drink menu, attentive service,  and a low key casual yet hip ambiance.  I hope this locally owned gem stays around for awhile as it's one I will definitely keep in our rotation!

SSwaNogsb4STf1caigT31Q.text: This was the first time I've been here. We waited a little over an hour for a table inside. They served drinks while waiting. The restaurant it's self is small so the waiting area isn't ideal. It would be nicer to wait outside but it's 120 in Phx right now. They have indoor & outdoor patio seating. I had a couple Melon Patch Fizzes while waiting......sooo refreshing! The 3 of us ordered a few small plates to share & 2 entrees to split so we could try a few different tastes. I couldn't even tell you everything we ordered but I do know the Pad Thai was one of my favorites. While seated at dinner I had the Laab Sided drink with fish sauce, it was very refreshing as well. The fish sauce added just the right amount of salty to the cocktail. The hour wait was well worth it! I will probably do take out the next time I'm starving though. The service from door to table was top notch!!!! If you haven't been to this gem spot, you're truly missing out!!! So go now! Check their days & hours open (they are weird)

f91InK4vmWMiCi4XVKOQHw.text: Super solid place with a great authentic menu. Give it a try! Great food and cocktails. Definitely worth the wait. Make a reservation, just in case.

t7KRiPOZ08rsBRSyGVXTsg.text: Our waitress provided the worst customer service at a restaurant in the last 30 years.  She was extremely unfriendly, lacked basic courtesy, and forgot part of an order. The long wait implies the food is great but the food is fair to good.  I'd recommend trying other Thai places.

QoJcp_TigS5kZDAI2lSu5A.text: This is by far the best Thai restaurant in Phoenix. Their menu is small and intentional - everything is very authentic with unique flavors. The owners have remembered us each time we've come and it has such a welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend sitting on the patio under the tea lights and ordering the chicken wings. They will 100% change your life. We also ordered the crab fried rice and there was a good amount of crab in it. It had onions and a lime in it with an awesome fish sauce to add to the top. We also ordered the mussels. The sauce the mussels come in is so good on white rice! Would definitely recommend ordering an extra side of rice to pour all your extra sauces on at the end. Our waitress also provided great service and helped us choose the best items on the menu (not that you can go wrong). Great restaurant for a date night or to celebrate a birthday.

bp3DFJw0KA7dVhYW99WaXQ.text: My new favorite restaurant! Came last week and a storm broke out in the middle of our dinner service. Th staff was amazing at trying to handle and accommodate all the changes, it wasn't an easy situation and a packed house. Food is always amazing and super tasty! For all the dining culture in Phoenix there are few that consistently offer great food and service, this one absolutely nails it.

lWrc0sDt_-wWqIK6Yq4-YA.text: Phenomenal pad thai. The best I have found in Phoenix. The atmosphere is great also. Very comfortable and inviting. Very friendly staff. Highly recommending giving Glai Baan a try!

kWeykTnVA_jZvavvTmcZHw.text: My boyfriend and I's favorite place to get Pad Thai. We are avid Pad Thai connoisseurs (not seriously but close) and have tried Pad Thai dishes across the valley, and this is by far our favorite! Not to mention the Thai tea is on point. The staff is VERY knowledgeable and the customer service is stellar. We'll forever be regulars!

VhKIBhcD48kGg1NXOAsKAA.text: Perfect place to take a date or celebrate a birthday. Max behind the bar can craft some killer cocktails. Let him make you something special. Must try the pork dumplings they are so good. We actually got another order for dessert because they were so good.

SzbuBfft6tzC9YrdA1Rn7g.text: Took the family there last night and can't say enough good things about this place.  Great cozy atmosphere, friendly, knowledgeable servers, delicious and authentic Thai food.  Give yourself a treat and try this place!

Tcd4TakkD0pCLoNXR-0M8w.text: Amazing Thai food!!! Nothing we tried was short of delicious!  But getting into this place is a pain.  They take reservations for parties of more than 5 but there were 4 of us.  It was the 3rd time we had tried to get in and almost left again, but really wanted to eat there.  Our friends humored us and we stood in the back of the restaurant and nursed a drink for over an hour.  People linger here.  It's a TINY place and when you can see that there are people crowded by the door, or standing at the back, you should just pay your darn check and leave!  The people at the table that we were told was going to be ours couldn't have been ruder, and sat at the table and drank water for a good 30 minutes after their check had been paid.  I wish this place had a bigger bar.  Waiting an hour is ok if you have a nice drink and a place to sit.  Oh and that brings me to the drinks!  Creative and really, really good!  The service is also incredible.

5CgXvuUZvxhLRTgzNOdf4A.text: Super friendly staff and great service! Very cute patio and interior. The food was outstanding! We will definitely be back! I just wish they were open for lunch too!

VozvNOShDXt7wFOGpuVCWA.text: My girlfriend & I come here often for their excellent food and even better service! Highly recommend!!

-C99eygfcyD4_ms9bV918A.text: OH MY GOSH!! This place was AMAZING! If you like Thai food, then look no further than this restaurant.   The service was unbelievable. From the moment we walked in, to when we left everyone was very friendly and attentive.  We had the pork dumplings, which you MUST have!! We also tried the PadThai, which was the best I've ever had.   Lastly, we had the Mango sticky rice. One of the best desserts I've had in a long time. 10/10 recommend.   Our waiter, Geraldo, was fantastic. He gave great recommendations and was on it.   Thank you to the amazing staff, we cannot wait to come back!

y626WdlBnfY7l4DZzpMq1A.text: Hidden gem!!!  We have been here 3-4 times now.  NEVER DISAPPOINTED!  Great service!  If your food "jaded" this place is for you!!!  Sweet and savory flavors that are refreshing as well as tantalizing.  Plenty of dishes to choose from if you can't do dairy.   Do yourself a favor, the mussels!  Served with the most amazing lemongrass/ginger sauce.  AMAZING!  One of those places you want to keep to yourself.  The owners work their restaurant as she cooks in the kitchen and he runs the floor.  TREAT YOURSELF!

gi1JvZ9XMh8nh1voF5Va7Q.text: I'm sure the food is good but I've been waiting over an hour for a to-go order and the are plenty of tables open.  The entire patio has turned over and people are done eating that arrived after me.

KeQvHyAss6IFCDqefGF1Pw.text: OBSESSED. I have recently gotten into Thai food and this place has officially bumped Thai food onto my top 3 favorite cuisines! To start, the ambience is soooo cute! I have been to Southeast asia a few times and this place is the perfect blend of southeast asia in america.  With the fooood, We first started with a papaya salad which was not overpowerring and was so good. The fish sauce wasn't too salty and the crispy pork belly was a good touch. We then got the Chinese Broccoli and pork belly rice dish. This dish was sooo soo goood! Sooo much flavor and the chinese broccoli just melts in your mouth.   We finished with an order of pork dumplings ( I know we did things backwards ). THE BEST DUMPLINGS! I don't know if they made then or if they came out of a bag but they were delicious!   10/10 I would def recommend this place!

m9ymseZMLDpsUuQF39PUmQ.text: First time here with my family and I had the best experience. Thai food is my favorite and this restaurant is like nothing Ive tried before. I had the green curry and topped it off with coconut custard for dessert.   The food was amazing, our waiter Gerardo was the best and it was such a great, welcoming environment. I definitely recommend!

P9KMDoLsk1YK5tbqPlsqyA.text: Let's start by saying I've been coming here every Tuesday for the past 3 weeks.  I eat out everyday, I love Thai food, this place is hands down the best Thai restaurant I've been to. The dumplings are amazing!!!!  The bucket with coconut water is so refreshing.  I always get the Kapro gal with shrimp and chicken, it's so flavorful, it's just right.  Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_OdUOSNiQ4dXW9XeqPevRQ.text: I was excited to try Glai Baan and with the reviews I saw on Yelp, I had high expectations.  Wah wah wah!  First off, if you were to the building when it was Mejico, you entered on the west side.  You can't do that now and there is nothing stating come to the front.  Okay, no biggie.  Inside it doesn't look much different than before.  Great!  It was always a cute place.  Drinks:  We wanted wine.  You don't order wine here. Their selection is mundane.  Whomever picks the wine has a very specific palate and think that everyone else must be the same.  If you want help with your wine selection, let me know.  :-)  Food:  Our table ordered Kanom jeeb.  They had good flavor and a nice dipping sauce.  I thought we were off to a good start. We also ordered: Pattaya beach grilled chicken -- greasy, tasteless strips of meat on the plate.  Kapro gai kai dao -- an enjoyable dish. Pad prik king -- an enjoyable dish.  We said we liked spicy -- 7 out of 10 on the scale.  We got a 2 out of 10 on the scale.  The mild sauce at Taco Bell has more spice.  The service was perfunctory.  All and all it was fine, but nothing there that will draw me in again.  There are better Thai food restaurants in Phoenix.

Ehr5EQraJGZzVIH8mk5LUg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place on our weekly date night. Everything about this place was amazing. The food, the service and the place were incredible.   The restaurant was very cute and quaint, and has a nice patio.  We had the pork dumplings and Tom Zap to start. Both were very flavorful and delicious. We fell in love with dumplings and if we weren't full we would have ordered more at the end of our meal.   For our main course we had the special (Jungle Curry) and Pad kee mao which is comparable to drunken noodles, again we were amazed. We would have drank the sauce in the jungle curry if it was socially acceptable.  For dessert we had the Kanom Custard, it had pieces of warm bread you dip into the custard it was on point, and an excellent finish to our meal.  The staff/owner/chef were all so friendly and welcoming. The owner/chef (Kat) came out and talked to us and all the other customers in the restaurant, she was very friendly. The bartender Max brought his own unique style to place, he made an amazing drink for me and was fun and friendly.  I will be telling all my friends to go here!

GzEQM7LyuxB2YHth7yIW5w.text: Really cute restaurant with nice patio. Food is excellent and service is always friendly. Reasonable pricing - limited parking.

xbvMpsUBeylw4L8s59_ecA.text: Ok so I been wanting to try this place out for months since I been hearing amazing reviews!! So my gf and I decided to check it out on a Wednesday. Since they open at 5pm, we figured we can meet at 530 and it won't be that packed... well we were WRONG!!!! The parking lot was completely full and there were no tables!! So we were fortunate to find two seats at the bar. Max was our awesome bartender!!! U have no idea how excited I was to try this place out! We were both starving!! I loved all the anime decor!! So cute!! We started off w the pork dumplings and chicken wings!! Omg!!! The taste will blow ur mind!!! Not to mention how crispy the wings were!! We ended up having double orders!!! They were that good!!!  For our main entrees, we decided to share the house special which was the panang green curry w noodles and we added crispy pork belly for protein in spice level 4. And we got the pad kee mao noodles w shrimp in spice level 4. Think we could have gotten Thai hot since my gf and I love super spicy but the flavors did not disappoint!! I especially LOVED the crispy pork belly w the dishes! From now on, I'll be only ordering that as my protein!!   And lastly, we decided to do the custard where u dip it in this coconut deliciousness! My god I was in food coma heaven! And we didn't break the bank either! I'll definitely b back!! What a gem  Highly recommend coming early and willing to wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai iced tea
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork dumplings!!! So so delicious!!

iA8kTQrSoMmmfdy-dC4xvA.text: I'm not usually one to crave Thai food, but came here per a friend's request and left very happily surprised. The food was amazing! We split a couple dishes between the 3 of us and loved them all. Sitting at the bar we got to know one of the owners. His passion about the food and culture behind the restaurant really showed through in his attention to detail and eagerness to interact with diners.  My only qualm is that I wish there was more seating for groups. I was in a group of four and we had to wait about an hour because there were only a couple tables that could fit us. Most of the tables are only two seaters. After one frost left because of time, we ended up opting for seats at the bar, but those are not open seating and we had to wait for those to be offered to us as well.  The staff was super friendly and kept giving us updates and offering to get us started on drinks. Would highly recommend making a reservation beforehand and carpooling as parking is very limited.

nKl0IwB7n8i6rbMcW2P6Wg.text: What to write in here? I have no words. The menu said they are "very thai" on it. I asked the waiter how very thai are they he goes- I'll take your order and you'll have to witness it yourself.  Ordered - Pad ke Mao: went with 2/4 spice level. Tasted really really good. Ambience - 5* Wait times - 0 mins Service - 5* Very Thai and very impressed.

XujumtXv-YHe-OPrrf5UTQ.text: Been here a few times now and have been pretty happy each time. I have ordered the wings, pad thai with crispy pork belly, dumplings, mackerel rice and the steak salad. All pretty good. Favorites are the steak salad, dumplings and pad thai. I have tried a few of their cocktails and the laab sides is hand down my favorite!!  Service is always great!  Parking can be a bit difficult, but I have always managed.

Cer7cDhfdqMSjNV_Dj9t-Q.text: WOW! This is worthy of a 10 star rating!   A much long over due review! However, the second time was even better!  I'm so in love with Glai Baan, from the authentic little restaurant, the servers, and the FOOD!   This menu is quite simple, but there's nothing "simple" about the food that comes out! I guarantee you, it's amazing! Every bite I took, made me say something, regarding how spectacular it was... I'm sure to the point of being annoying! (I didn't care!)  I enjoy this restaurant so much!   They inspire to be VERY THAI, and serve street food! It literally transports you to the streets of Thailand, and I've never even been there, haha!  But honestly, there's something about it, I guess because it's so organic, a True first time flavor, that is so different then you expect to have!   We ordered the steamed buns, then we ordered 2 more orders! These are far the BEST I've ever had!  We had the fried mushrooms-delicious, Chicken wings- crispy and so tender, panang curry-(absolutely Devine!) Pad kee mao the best,- fried rice, and pad -Thai! Incredible!   This place gets very busy, they don't take reservations, but hang in there, it's worth every minute you wait!

zg3QFntb02W7AokJ1lU3YA.text: The best way I can describe the food here at Glai Baan is authentic and supremely delicious. There is no doubt in my taste buds. Touting their menu as "street food" they serve the most formidable amazing dishes. They have an inside and outside seating area with every table occupied. A line of hungry people waiting to be seated. So when I say "run" and enjoy this restaurant, it is not metaphorically.   Our cohorts were Joyce and Micheal W. So the evening was already off to a great start. We even sat at the same table together! First and foremost, alcohol! They have a well thought out wine list and great list of beers. We ordered a bottle of white wine and beer. Cheer's! So here's the skinny on the PHAT (pretty hot and tempting) food we devoured:  *Started with pork dumplings which come 5 to an order. So good, we ordered 2! Please see photo. *Papaya Salad- super delicious papaya with cherry tomato and a homemade fried pork skin, what?! Yup! Please see photo. *Pork skewers- came out sizzling from the grill and an aroma that allowed no time to waste! Eaten viciously!  *Shrimp Padthai- noodles bathed in sauce then stir fried perfectly with a succulent chewiness! Squeeze the lime and Mmm!  *Fried chicken- Crispy Crispy skin with a perfect chili sauce accompaniment. It is not your regular fried chicken but 2 notches above.  *TomYum soup- please see photo!  *Panang Curry- braised tender beef in a wonderful red curry. Mop this one up with rice!   While some were busy taking photos, I took the opportunity to cheat, (since we were suppose to share) eating ahead. The menu is varied but not overly busy and pricing is extremely reasonable.  Because they don't take reservations, my suggestion is to arrive early; 5-5:30pm and you'll be ok. Past the 6 O'clock hour, it gets jumping busy. The food is definitely worth the wait ;) They have a parking lot attached although a bit cramped.   Thank you for reading =)

MfhPg5kPsI2hwWMqDQO2bw.text: To be honest, when I see a reviewer has given 5stars to basically every place that they've reviewed, it makes me a little leery of their judgement. But hey, who wants to learn about three star places?! Now I've realized that if it's any less than 5 stars I'm not going to waste my time writing about it.  So please don't be thrown by the fact that pretty much anything I've written about I've given 5 stars to.  I  feel a little silly for even writing a review on this place because they don't need it! If you've eaten there, you get it, if you haven't, then I'm sure someone will tell you to. Everything about Glai Baan is amazing, from the tiny, hole in the wall yet comfy feeling to the staff with great energy and good vibes to the outstanding food! I can not say enough about this place. They have a really interesting drink selection and were very accommodating with our vegetarian diet. We have NEVER had better Thai food in a better atmosphere being served by better people. Try something out of your comfort zone, it'll be well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steamed bread with coconut custard

hK9VA-fDOTQsIaNWzn_43A.text: Enjoyed street thai food at Glai Baan located near 24th Street and Osborn Road in Phoenix. First visit here on Saturday for birthday dinner treat. A line was waiting outside before they opened for dinner service which is always a good sign.  Waited about 15 minutes and reviewed the menu. The street food (like tapas) are a great concept, lots of variety, fresh flavors, and excellent service here.  Glai Baan is a small unique restaurant. They have a small full bar that has some tables. The main dining area is cozy and can accomodate larger groups. There is also an outside dining option on the patio.  We shared 5-6 different plates as they were completed. Hands down the favorites were the Kanom Jeeb steamed pork dumplings served with a scallion ginger soy sauce and  the grilled pork skewers.   Other plates included: papaya salad (Sumtum), glass noodles with shrimp in a tasty herb lime dressing (Yum Eoon Sen), crispy marinated chicken wings (Peek Gai Tod).  The last plate before our food coma was an excellent dish that included chicken, chinese broccoli, bamboo shoots and noodles. Hard to keep track of what we ordered but all was consumed and  all good. Spicy dishes are marked with a chili pepper.   Servers and management were friendly and engaging, made you feel welcome. Parking is limited but can park at the next door business after they close or Uber/Lyft.  Bookmarked this one for a return visit.

JAsRK3DuGW7C0M7wPJb5rQ.text: I went here for a date night. It's a small place so parking can be crazy to begin. It's a popular spot though so expect a wait. We killed time at a cool bar close by. When we sat down we were hungry so we ordered right away. It took about 40 minutes for our food to the table. (Don't go on an empty stomach) I got the chicken pad Thai because I'm basic but it's one of my favorite dishes so whatever. It was good but I could use some more flavor. I also thought the portion size was relatively small. Maybe it's because I have a take out Thai place that hooks it up. Am I too picky for this app? Anyways. I ordered they delivered it just isn't a favorite. Worth at least a visit.

YpSVRk5_iICnAOayRBG3Kg.text: The best restaurant in Phoenix! Every single item on the menu is worth trying, and they are all amazing! Their drinks are all top notch as well! Their staff is one of the nicest I've ever experienced.

QHZrjsiV_E9Mn9vwLZzVEA.text: My wife is currently obsessed with this place, and I have to say I can't argue with her. There will ALWAYS be a wait from my experience, and it is always worth the wait. The place is tiny, and parking is a literal nightmare, but the food is just out-of-this-world. We have loved everything we've ordered. I especially suggest trying out a handful of appetizers to share, including the chicken wings and dumplings. The cocktails are fun and the wine list is actually really impressive.   In essence, this is not your average Thai place. In fact, it's not really like anything I've had to this point, and I love every bit of that.

m7e6ReG8R53qyMEBw0SptQ.text: "Let's order the steamed dumplings."  "The pot stickers?"  "No, the dumplings," Jon reiterates while throwing me a withering glance. It was at that moment that Jon realized that I was a lowly potato out to raise some blood pressures.  :'D  We strolled into this adorable place after having a couple glasses of champagne by invitation of Jon H. and his lovely wife. Having never been here, I was ready to try EVERYTHING. We ordered a few small plates to share: pork skewers, steamed dumplings, spicy crab papaya salad, and rice cakes. We also ordered tom yum soup, panang curry, green curry, and shrimp pad thai just for good measure. Everything we had ordered was effectively polished off. Easily the best Thai food in the valley! I was especially enamored by the steamed dumplings, the pan-fried rice cakes [I thought these were gonna be like tteokbokki but it's not], and the panang curry. There was some slow-braised magic in that pot of panang curry and if I wasn't in public, I would have licked, no --- ATE the bowl!  Advertised as Thai street food, I can see why this place is so popular! It's a cozy eatery with some indoor and outdoor seating. It gets packed fast so come during off-peak hours. Time to go visit your Thai grandma for some good eats! Not Thai? Yeah, me neither but at Glai Baan, we're all just one big happy family!

aO-doQHThC0IJwvp-YD87g.text: Quaint atmosphere with outdoor seating and friendly service. I Ike that it's open until 11pm for us night owls. I went on a Tuesday night around 8:30pm and the place was packed!   My favorite was the mussels with a curry sauce with a lemongrass-like tang. The mackerel fries rice was good, and came with a sliced hard boiled egg, and side of spicy fish sauce (I think). It took the peppers out of the sauce and mixed it in with the rice and it wasn't too spicy. I would have liked this dish more if it had more greenery like fresh basil or some type of veggie (diced Chinese broccoli. The pork belly with Chinese broccoli was good but didn't wow me. It had lots of Chinese broccoli, and the pork wasn't overly fatty. The pork is similar to Chinese BBQ pork.  I like the food well enough, and I plan on trying other dishes next time!

BjBvZzEu-EBZQh_YwyUcnw.text: My boyfriend and I found ourselves in the cutest patio with the nicest people at this new restaurant.  We had the mussels which were SO good, the broth definitely deserve some rice.  Then we had the Kao soi which was super interesting, for sure out of my normal palate which is super appreciated.  It was actually a bit chilly so we enjoyed some very nice hot jasmine tea.  Thinking we were full and ready to leave a gentleman brought out a complimentary dessert of some fantastic sweet bread with a custard.  Overall the service was welcoming and so sweet, I really welcome this new establishment and wish them well with their endeavors.  Thank you!

Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not wanting to leave our dessert, going back for one more bite.

yDfgNmjSqwZIsIYfT3jKbQ.text: Thank the food Gods for this slice of heaven. I recently moved to PHX from FL and have been struggling to find good food let alone good Thai food. I've struck out with most restaurants in general but, whatever standard the Thai restaurants cook by here have been whack. UNTIL GLAI BAAN!   There was a 45 min wait upon my arrival but, a delicious glass of Tempranillo rosado kept me occupied. I knew this place stood a chance just based on some of their unique cocktail descriptions. I will certainly be back to try them all.   We finally got our table which came complete with a very personable and humorous Everett; our server. He came out of the gates with a few suggestions and it was all magic from there.   We ordered the green papaya salad WITH pork belly. SO GOOD. Fresh, clean flavors. The dumplings are out of this world. I could've eaten just these two things and been satisfied. Next up was their "son in law egg". Essentially a fried hard boiled egg dressed with a delicious sauce. The simplicity of its flavors was delicious. Then came the chicken wings. I don't know what wizardry was in the batter but my goodness. Light yet crunchy. Subtle hints of fried garlic. A delicious and perfectly spiced sauce for dipping. One of the best chicken wings I've ever had. We may have squeezed in a second order of dumplings. Don't judge. You will for sure be doing the same. Last but, not least, pad Thai with shrimp. The shrimp were huge and perfectly cooked. A nice balance of tamarind sweetness and savory flavors. My friend loves heat so Everett brought us this delicious slow burn of a hot sauce with incredible cilantro and vinegar flavor. One of those creep on ya slow burns.   Everything was delicious. The vibe of the place is intimate yet social. Very cozy and friendly. I will absolutely be back.

LFd8WiCqWWhmoly75BQwwg.text: Randomly found this place when I had a late night Thai craving and wow, it exceeded my expectations! The place was so cute and had an amazing vibe. My husband got a Thai lager that was so good. We got the dumplings and the special which was glass noodles and shrimp. It was some of the best Thai food I have ever had. The service was also great. We will definitely be back here!

q9r4I4aT9J67-bOAwDIQJQ.text: OMG! Best Thai in Phoenix! We have been here twice and not only is the food exceptional (you pick the spice level), but Chef Kat and Dan are the most generous hosts who have selected a personable and amazing team to deliver excellent service. The sweet and intimate environment makes for a lovely evening of deliciousness and great conversation. Must try: pork dumplings to start. Don't order just one serving, just go ahead and order two! You'll also love the charming patio on perfect spring and fall evenings.

bDKE8V2hV5aqpwBST1zVfg.text: Food and drinks were fantastic! It's open seating at the bar and the bartender is amazing!! Definitely will be coming back!

qgiS_csAmeBr55CEiiSxRg.text: Amazing experience!! From the second I pulled in to park I  knew I made the right choice. Very cosy ambiance, attentive staff, and the food is so delicious and flavorful. I believe the chefs name is Kat and she seems as sweet as can be. I've always been a fan of Thai food. This place takes it to another level. Best Thai food I've ever had hands down.

Dg52cULGU_SmEgdvGz1CGQ.text: Came here last night for dinner and I'm in love! I had the green curry with rice noodles-one of the specials of the evening and it was one of the best green curries I've had in a long time. The flavors are spot on and the chicken was so tender and juicy! The steamed pork dumplings were to die for! They had good texture and a very nice dipping sauce. The Panang curry had a big chunk of braised beef that also was delicious.  We sat outside on the patio which is lit with lights and the restaurant itself is so cute with vines all over and has a super cool relaxed eclectic atmosphere.  Service was great too! Will be back for sure to try more dishes! They really do Thai right here! Check it out! Was so good that we didn't even take pictures!

R4S6EdXFjPFrigE3mKkm2Q.text: We had searched high and low for amazing Thai food in Phoenix, and thought we would never find it...then Glai Baan opened. We have tried almost everything on the menu at this point and nothing has been a disappointment. If you're lucky enough to go when they have Tom Kha Gai soup on special, it is A MUST! The cocktails are amazing, the service is wonderful, the food is delicious. We've been there so many times that they greet my husband by name and say "Welcome back". It's a culinary gem, and a fun environment!

9p61biATChSDr1ZPdxF5pw.text: SOOO GOOD! Everything I've ever had on the menu is delicious! All fresh ingredients, delicious food, fun environment, good service! I've been many times and will continue to go!

3cECCKz6P_bE8uXUoA4Sbg.text: You haven't been here yet?! One of the best hidden gems in AZ. I could write a raving, book long review, but instead I will just agree to every wonderful thing said in all the reviews before me. It is a small place (part of the charm/fun), and does get really busy, so if you go during peak hours you will most likely have to wait. If so, either A) do your taste buds a favor and stick it out. Or B) go grab a beer down the street at Wren House for 45 minutes and stumble back when your table is ready.

Y9T4cBkhlO7eYmWTSODMPg.text: Alright, look, let's be honest here. The food is pretty good. If you are looking for authentic curry, then Glai Baan has it. If you are looking for pad Thai, just go to your local Thai spot down the street and pay $9.95 instead.  However, here comes the real issue and sorry if this sounds savage. We sat down at 7:50. We are decent people and waited about 8-10 minutes and didn't get annoyed. Finally we were asked what we wanted. After 25 minutes, some pork dumplings came out. Good? Yes. $8 for 5 dumplings the size of a baby's hand? Cmon bro!   After about 30 minutes a gentleman came by and said we were next for entrees. Some sick foreplay joke? One could assume. 8:45 comes along, no food. I mean 55 minutes is already a crime. It gets worse. We ask how long and they say we are the next ticket. Another stroke of my cactus..... 8:55 comes only my husbands food comes. I'm livid at this point. Y'all were not even that busy. Not every table was taken. Cmon fam!   My food came at 9. 1 hour and 10 minutes after arrival. I'm not a stickler for service but I ordered a plate of god forsaken pad Thai. The traditional spot can whip that up down the street and it takes 3 minutes.. and it tastes better.  Look the food is good, the curry specifically. But $47 and a stomach ulcer from anger ain't worth this place.  No tip. You guys need to figure it out. Goodbye Glai Baan.

ZW_5wbLU349jRAeD2iQwmg.text: Food is excellent. Fresh and authentic thai street food. Staff was very personable, helpful, and accommodating. This is a good place to go with a small group and share things family style. That way you get to try a bunch of different dishes. Love the interior too!  Will definitely come again!

JaG1pGZuOym3S5W6ScxEGA.text: The best Thai I've had in Phoenix. I had the pork dumplings to start and panang curry and both were delicious. Only downside is that it's a pretty small restaurant, so expect to wait a bit for a table.

o0LhxYq6IHmLoif5TVpnrA.text: This place is absolutely the most amazing thai food you are gonna get in the valley.  Northeastern thai is a flavor bomb and will amaze you. I am thai and i can't speak more highly of this place.

IiiYDRugBdw0qB5eMGs11g.text: Spot on! Very nice menu.  The quality was great tried 5 different dishes.  4 out of 5 were excellent.  And 1 dish was ok...  4 out of 5 stars only because I was under the impression that it was Thai "street food".    I think the concept is great but delivers a confusing message on Menu with portions and pricepoint.  Just go Northern Thai restaurant...  you are after all a restaurant!  Great wine program/beverage program....!  I have a feeling on my next visit I will be changing it to 5 stars...  Thanks for being in Phoenix!

EpomoRPxSqHfEsBO2wftqw.text: Great food in an intimate, private space.  Glass noodles with ginger, garlic, and shrimp came together perfectly.

FGch4rdB3mlLXRcnq60fHw.text: Yum. Yum yum yum yum yum yum yum.  Everything is good about this place. Food- check, authentic- check, cocktails- check check. ambience- super check. Cozy- check, unpretentious- check. Friendly- check. Service- check.   This is not Americanized/phx boring thai. me love you long time Glai Baan. Come as you are. Come with twinkles and stars. It is special place, a little gem .

upx_q-fR3BrkYyJ_xULMdA.text: Went to Glai Baan last night, food portions are tiny, pretty expensive. We had about 5 cocktails, little cups. 10$/cocktail. Soup too sweet for us, everything was pretty sweet, the sauce that came with the chicken was too salty. will try again, if they are improved i will change the rating.

2-38JN_idryzy4A1BWcitA.text: WOW!! From the food to the service to the decor this place is a TEN!! We had the pad Thai, steak salad and a specialty Thai dish and they were all incredible. Best Thai food I've ever had in the States. The friendly staff was very attentive and helpful in suggesting our delicisous dishes. The decor is adorable! There are pictures of the owners family from Thailand, great mood lighting, cozy patio and vintage furniture which give this restaurant a great vibe. I can't wait to go back again!
