aZqRZ5ZKM8cj-Sm3eBIRAw.text: The atmosphere here is awesome! The servers are very nice and the chef even came out to chat with me and my gf. I ordered the Pad Thai which was phenomenal. The dessert with the bread and green sauce was very interesting. Overall, it feels like you are transported to a little Thai bungalow when you come here. This is one of my new go to Thai restaurants. Good stuff!

soiJ-xhWpLcA3NE0OAJsMg.text: After all of the talk, I couldn't wait. Thought it was going to be amazing. Just ok in my opinion.

Xlx2nA8fCJ2nTpg198KuNg.text: It was kind of busy for a Tuesday night but the staff was very friendly and the wait wasn't nearly as long as they estimated. When seated, the waiter was very professional; friendly; and gave good suggestions. The menu had plenty of great options but wasn't too over one page which is great! The food was fresh and very tasty. The restaurant is super cute: small and homely. Oh the portion size is really nice.

e9SpTTGSvLk6-exxfAthwA.text: The good news is that it's better than all the Thai restaurants I've been to in Phoenix.  I'm from the East Coast and not that I believe we have better Thai restaurants in the East Coast I just haven't found a good one since I've been here... that is until they opened GB around the corner.  I've only been in Phoenix a year and I was back East my entire life, so in all fairness, I've had more time to find good Thai back East.  I ordered the pad Thai.  The flavors were spot on.  The heat was right on.  They are cooking from the heart, for the love of food and the love of cooking.  I order the Pad Kee Mao mostly and it doesn't disappoint.  They have, in the last few months made some adjustments to the "streety-ness" of the food, probably due to time and the size of clientele, product availability? It hasn't hurt the integrity of the product.  Please, no more changes.  I've also tried the Son-in-Law eggs.  It was good.  Damn good.  It had an rustic flavor.  I couldn't get away from the fact I was eating an egg in a bowl with rice and when I know what else is on the menu I rather try that.

xRUACP27gkxsoWGTGkHidw.text: I've been to Thailand twice and have traveled extensively around the world. This is one of very very few truly authentic Thai restaurants outside of Thailand. Simple, authentic flavors. Wonderful staff. To overlook this place would be unfortunate. Please make time to visit Glai Baan.

QUnySmDQyXlwU7w6vaefug.text: Top-notch Thai food with a good vibe. Try the son-in-law eggs. They were fantastic, and I'd never had them before.

jntDkXJSjseYbkrf3DHUvQ.text: Glai Baan is our favorite Thai spot in Phoenix! Every single dish is so delicious! The dumplings are amazing!

N4dkl_E9OGsdF-QcG-N4yg.text: So excited to try last night! Everything just great and the dumplings to die for! Seriously - we ordered a second order and still craving more today. We'll be back a lot I'm sure!

nODazfRZRF8D7e7NYHbO2Q.text: This is my new favorite Thai Place in town. Ordered the mussels, pad Thai and ribs today. Food came out quickly and wait staff was very attentive and the bartender Max was awesome! What set Glai Bann apart from the completion was the powerful explosion of flavors in the dishes. It's very authentic and the taste was something I haven't experienced before. Very cutest outdoor patio as well.

W07hmux4rsmwh2RLAVCgIw.text: Some interesting and different dishes. Love the son in law eggs, a kind of soft boiled and lightly fried egg in scrumptious sauce. Little plates is the theme. So we had tasty and non-spicy dumplings, savory pork skewers and spicy pad ki mao. Tried the bread dessert too.  It is Hawaiian bread/ cake like fish with a surprisingly green custard with a light mint flavor.

cLqfmVOmvRAtURIvlOOt7Q.text: The food is AMAZING.  The place is super cool and within walking distance of my house.  The bar area is small but it's so cool I could hang out there for a while with good friends, and the outdoor space is really cool too.  I hope Glai Baan is watching these reviews because my only complaint is what others are saying.  Portion sizes are too small for the main dishes.  I am a small person and I'm still hungry after eating my entire entree.  If the portion was bigger and more filling, it would be 5 stars across the board!  Reviews are always update-able though ;)  I will be back!!

eY3j-upZviqYoo_vVp48bA.text: You have to try this restaurant! Beautiful atmosphere with amazing food and people! Fully expect to become a regular here :)

65DsEloD3wBjNaLdcQxjYQ.text: This was a place were there was great food and great service.but the food was a little to salty and the dessert was very good.

Ay-bDejN2-BcYIP9mMTVnA.text: This is a Thai restaurant and they actually put a little blurb on their menu about how they model their food after a certain northwestern area of Thailand. Then they add that it can be quite spicy for that reason and they designate spicier dishes with a chili pepper. It's small plates which I find is a great way to try new things. The restaurant is tucked down on 24th and Osborn and it is quite adorable it looks like it was a house but that means it is small, not uncomfortable but small nonetheless. I will say that we went around 6 and as we were leaving every table was taken and the bar was full and at least 4 groups were waiting for a table. Always a good sign. Anyways the food was amazing. You have to be willing to try new things even if you can't pronounce them. Remember it's authentic so the Thai names are used and then there is a description. The dumplings were good. There was a noodle dish with shrimp and minced pork which I loved. The flavor was so good. We had a pork belly rice dish which had I known I would have asked for MILD spice cause it was hot for me but not bad for my friend. We also had a steak salad which was SUPER generous with the meat and again great flavor. There were a number of people who ordered some sort of mint green drink served in a champagne glass. Anyway I recommend this place for sure.

PUgCEJ70cBMEkow9GyP2RA.text: Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. Everything from the food to the decor to each and every little dumpling seems to be very thought out and done with love and care. The staff is very sweet and accommodating. The owner/chef seems to be loved by her staff and her passion and hard work definitely shows to her customers.

K8OMB2twM0mW_UuKK7cuPw.text: The food is ridiculously good here. I've been about 3 or 4 times and I have never had a dish I did not like.

tSGdVILzKe544V0FrbDsGA.text: Authentic khao soi. Amazing. Seriously strong menu all around.

i4hp45MxHJHKzdTV5c2hdw.text: Food was exceptional. Had dumplings, muscles and pad Lee mao. The mango and sticky rice for dessert was amazing also!

QY-UEJv-09ZMUjolCXV_Yg.text: Menu is simple and different. Each dish is full of very developed flavors. I live 30 minutes from here but it's our favorite Thai spot. lrF-lIK2AsRMdLc1GghyWA.text: Recommended by the owner of our airbnb, we called ahead to pick up our pad Thai and chicken wings(20 min wait) Busy place, hipster crowd, and so f'in good, that if you miss this spot, you'll regret it.

AlXyqLhWx_OP29MlCBkCoQ.text: An absolutely marvelous example of authentic Thai cuisine. The Kai soi was hot but the perfect pain is pleasure meal. Wj4pIckfNe81o9Z8gRM6Ng.text: Totally worth the take on taste.  I found this gem through networking places to eat with friends and work or I probably wouldn't have found it.  Small and not hard to find off 23rd st and Osborne if You don't know where to look you may pass by once twice maybe. I don't find any fault in that I just wasn't sure where to look and it was all just spur of the moment.   The tastes are intense and the portions although not extravagantly huge are appetizing and filling enough... especially if you have friends go with and you all share each other's course.  So let's see... there is a host and the service isn't bad. Although they do get busy enough as any good restaurant where you may want to flag down a server for more water but that's about it. No pushing  you through your meal... they are great at describing the item you may interested in when asked about it.  Parking lot is decent size and fills up but the store next door is empty/ as in closed down and moved  and I use that lot as do others  If you want a great take on Thai food that has tastes unlike any I've had here in Phoenix I recommend here.

Peszdk0FiXpAMxmcBM2K_w.text: great service but the food was mediocre besides the dumplings. The menu is uber limited like someone that watched too much Kitchen Nightmares and the staples arent that interesting. The noodle and chick dish was small portions and bland. The green curry that was on special had a nice taste but then paired with eggplant and rice noodles versus rice ruined what could have been a good dish but it wouldn't matter, it was just a special. The portions of meat were too small and its flavor seems like it was all cooked at the same time and then added after.  I wont be back considering the other great thai restaurants in the area like Thaiger or Thairama depending on the dish you are craving.

P1UeZTML2i8gdY9W35lKZg.text: Great food and service! Enjoyed everything we ate. Reasonably price and nice environment. Really liked the Thai tea with lemon juice! My husband enjoyed the filet dish and we both liked the chicken wings and dumplings. Again everything we had was great!

bVk0RK5PYhTbwz8MQ54AYQ.text: I found the food here disappointingly bland. I ordered the picked crap papaya salad expecting it to be very spicy based on the menu's warning. Tby2VtMlJBJK0avPv65yzA.text: Food is amazing.   You can't go wrong.  We had a wonderful first experience.  Food is perfectly spiced. Braised beef just melt in your mouth .

252jtgHH2DHUD6jMbugKmg.text: Cozy atmosphere.   Delicious food.  Host was super friendly and server was really attentive.

dVzbNI7NCEKZfsFtY1Uwbw.text: My boyfriend grew up eating home cooked Thai food so when we heard about this little place opening up, which specializes in Thai street food, we knew we had to give it a try. Its only been open for 5 days, yet its clear they're already getting tons of business (we saw multiple groups come and go despite it being 10PM when we came in).  We were worried that we would have a hard time finding it, but since its right next door to the old Mr Submarine shop, and very brightly and invitingly lit, there ended up being no problem. Parking was quick and easy and there was no wait to be seated. They have multiple seating options ranging from bar, patio, to their dining room and each is beautifully lit and cozy. We loved the farm house ambience with the soft Thai music playing in the background.   Their menu is still small at the moment as they work to expand but their wine list was quite impressive! Our waiter was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and answered any questions we had. We started out with an order of dumplings, which we were a bit dismayed to find were steamed dumplings when they arrived. However despite not usually being a fan of steamed dumplings, we both loved them, our only complaint was there weren't more of them!  When it came to our actual dishes we were a bit let down, unlike many other Thai restaurants, they did not ask for a desired heat level. This worried my boyfriend as he likes his food to be almost beyond eating with spiciness, and I can be a bit of a wimp. I had nothing to fear however as my dish wasn't very spicy at all, but he was let down as his was listed as spicy but lacked even enough heat for ME to register.  I'll admit that I have had very little Northern Thai dishes so I wasn't sure what to expect, and I was a bit let down. My dish was 80 percent rice, the pork belly mostly fatty and far from crispy, and lacking any of the signature tastes I look for in Thai food. My boyfriend's dish was very aromatic and had a very pleasant taste but reminded me more of Indian food than Thai in its seasonings.   All in all we were pretty let down, especially considering we ended up spending 40 plus dollars on two entrees, one Thai tea, and an appetizer when at most places we could have received twice that amount of food for the price. But as the restaurant gets its feet more on the ground we hope to come back and try more of their food, especially their Nom Tok (Thai beef salad) as that is one of my favorite dishes.   So give this place a try if you're looking for a casual yet intimate setting, or late night fare that isn't a Berto's (they're open until 11pm during the week and until 12:30pm on Fridays and Saturdays). Their food is locally sourced, they cater to any dietery restrictions you may have, and their staff are all wonderful!

YuRda_X6gfrd7zsmXFk_7w.text: These guys don't even answer their phone, I called 5 times, I just get voicemail. And they have no take out information on their website...

fldzB5p8SECht625ak1C6Q.text: I really wanted to like this place, but sadly, I did not. This was recommended by someone else as his favorite Thai restaurant in the valley, so granted, expectations may have been a little on the higher side. I wouldn't say it was BAD, but it was just mediocre. We started off the the papaya salad and the dumplings. The dumplings were the best part of the meal. It's very meaty and similar to shu mai that you would find at a dim sum restaurant, but with more of a scallion/pork flavor and less of a shrimp flavor. Although they were pretty good, at $8 a pop, I'd rather go to a legit dim sum place and get shu mai for about half the price or less. The papaya salad was decent as well, and the pork belly was cooked very well with crispy skin and all. Interestingly, it was served with chicharrones on top, which I personally have never seen at any Thai restaurant (including those in Thailand).   The mains were a little disappointing. The khao soi had a lot of potential and the flavor was good, but it was just way too salty. After a few bites, I couldn't handle the saltiness any longer. I ended up packing it to go, making noodles at home, and diluting it at home which actually made it pretty good. If you have low tolerance for saltiness, I would avoid the khao soi. The pad kee mao was average and didn't really stand out from noodles I've had in other Thai restaurants.  I did like the atmosphere of the place, especially the outdoor seating area. It was much more quiet and low-key than inside the restaurant, which was filled with people waiting in the front for seats. You may want to request an outdoor seat if you want something more intimate (as long as it's not during the summer season here). No issues with service either, as it was pretty attentive.   Overall, I would just say this place is OK. However, the prices did seem a little high compared to other Thai restaurants (which I can understand since it would make a nice, little date place). If you've lived in very Asian centric areas like LA/Bay Area or perhaps you've done quite a bit of traveling in Asia, you may be a bit disappointed. Since I live about 30 plus minutes away, I probably don't see myself coming here again.

fxhaC2Lp5bRVw3dp0T7oeg.text: This place is delicious! Go early or be prepared to wait for a seat. Cozy and quaint, the food is worth the wait. We sat the bar and shared several appetizers and entrees. Each one was better than the last. Definitely get the mushroom salad and the Padkeemao.

UqHIhK8U50y7OmXgEeSVFw.text: Everything was fantastic.  Dumplings. Tom yum. Service was incredible. Drinks are unique and tasty.  Do not miss this place.

jllziiu4QOMr6nGyyad9kw.text: If you're thinking about trying g this place out DO IT!! You will not be disappointed. My favorites are the Panang beef, pad Thai and crab fried rice.

XDF5913Q2CNjcbW_gDhqAA.text: Wow! This place is absolutely amazing! My husband and I both work in the restaurant industry and finally had a night out together and I am SO glad we heard about this amazing gem! From the moment we walked in we were treated with such warmth and genuine hospitality, we sat outside in a beautiful setting and from there it just went beautifully from the service, to the incredible food!  We started with the servers suggestion of craft cocktails, which we were automatically blown away by that my husband had to order almost every one they were so good and pared perfect with the menu well done to Max, the bartender, he even visited us at our table! From there could not wait to taste the food! The beef salad and dumplings were out of this world, the chefs special entree was so good it felt like a genuine home cooked meal the broth was simple and so flavorful I wish I could have it every day! I ordered the pad Thai and it was probably the best I have ever had and that says a lot. With the owner Dan (who was the person who greeted and sat us) coming over and filling our water, checking on us it just put this place over the top. After everything I had to try dessert and man am I glad we did! WOW kanom custard!!! What a perfect end to a perfect dining experience. My husband and I have worked in restaurants our whole life, from fine dining to both working for some of the top chefs in the world and we can not express to Dan and Cat our thanks for hosting this incredible dining experience for us, both working in the industry as you know it's rare to have time together and last night, you really made it a beautiful memory. We will for sure be back. Thank you again.

UBAEdeQzy1_W8mbIjPSdDA.text: This is one of the best Thai places not only in Phoenix but in the country. Great vibe, at the bar or sitting down. The wait staff is OUTSTANDING, extremely nice, call you by your name, very helpful in picking out what to eat/drink on the menu. Food is very authentic, excellent taste and fresh. I went in w my girlfriend and we both walked away very satisfied and happy, had to tip 25% because the staff was so great. Come in, grab a drink, enjoy a great vibe and great food w a great staff, tough to beat.

BYgU--27FG9rGXofiYqkHw.text: So so good! On the pricier side for Thai, I opted for the shrimp pad thai and I was not disappointed! Fresh, hot and large jumbo shrimp were cooked perfectly. I will definitely be coming back to dine in instead of take out next time!

EGQJjsniLSII2_6alyDwEg.text: Totally worth the wait! As other reviews have indicated, this place is small and most tables are intended to be two or four tops. Because it is popular and it's small size, plan on a wait during regular dinner hours but just use that time to enjoy a drink like Hitochino Nest's Lager and soak up the atmosphere as there is plenty of it!      After 30 min.s, we were seated on the patio which is cute. (Picture included)      We started with the crab papaya salad. It is beautifully executed and the crab was crunchy and fun to eat but if you don't love fish sauce pick another small plate. Next we shared the panang curry with an extra side of rice. This was delicious! It is slow roasted chunks of beef in a curry sauce- the meat is so tender it just melts in your mouth. My husband said it was the best curry he has had (and he is no stranger to curry on his GF diet).      Finally, We ended with dessert (not on menu but ask your server). Sticky rice with Mango... their's is a warm rice with a buttery coconut sauce and fresh cool mango...terrific. (Picture of our empty dessert bowl.)      Yummy. We look forward to our return already.

qvhPZ-H777AlTNxAYZLexA.text: Amazing flavors, great atmosphere, there is nothing here that is not good. The menu is very focused and not the standard Thai restaurant menu you see which may force you to branch out of your comfort zone and try something new. It's all delicious  though!

FqDck7dFajSrHkp8M3rtfg.text: I'm so happy to have this restaurant right around the corner from my house! I've tried a few different things here and everything has been great but my absolute favorite is the Panang Curry

gmsxgy-NEX4HNuy6gBFx1g.text: Soooo yummy! It's been recommended since it opened and finally made it. They are not open for lunch and I work downtown so I found it difficult to find a time to go down for dinner but it was worth the drive. They have the most adorable outdoor patio and a super charming indoor ambience and delicious food. It did not disappoint.

fcFLVxjxnPw_mk53U1N33g.text: Do not come here if you think this is your typical Westernized Thai joint. Come to Glai Baan ONLY if you want try something entirely new and take your palette on an adventure.   Atmosphere: It feels like you're in a historic AZ home, that has been transported to a village bar in Thailand.   Service: These people are all about the food. There is no glitz and no kitch. It's all about the flavor. That's not to say the service isn't warm. It is. But there won't be any plastic smiles or "Let me tell you about the specials". It's all about the food.   Cocktails: I had a Mekong, mostly because Roger Clyne talks about it in his music and I always wanted to see what it tastes like. It was delightful. However, would've preferred it as a digestif. It has that herbal and sweet thing that's great after a meal. The Orange Blossom Ale from Huss was the perfect compliment to the spice and citrus components of the food.   Food: We did the Dumplings...cuz ya kinda have to...and this crab noodle salad. The salad was very unique and refreshing; rice noodles, cherry tomatoes, the perfect amount of spice, and crab as more a seasoning than the star of the dish. The Panang totally ruined all other Panang curries for me. I had their equivalent of Drunken Noodles, which I cannot remember the name of. Pork Belly, wide rice noodles, and again...perfect spice. But, I like spicy, so do not think it's for everyone. They are more than happy to tone it down for the sensitive tum-tums. out there.

tTyeCT1olSPMJuAl4tNqUg.text: So. Freaking. Delicious! So excited to have tried a new to us Thai place. Picked up an order on Valentines after work. Glad I ordered out because the place was hoppin! People were waiting for tables, long line, what else do you expect on this lovely holiday. Super cute atmosphere though! Can't wait to do a date night here with husband when not so crazy busy. Staff was super friendly as well.

JuOzDClunhmiBpnz6IIjzQ.text: Beautiful  yummy food. Attentive staff. Appropriately priced.  Listes as 4 just because we needed more table space for our dishes and drinks.

P2MGl7pozbytiexCkAM3LQ.text: Good place for some good Asian food. Adequate choices, friendly service and not too pricey.

6a9xzGwEo7uI5uF4t3ucsQ.text: Glai Baan is a beautiful, authentic Thai restaurant that is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. For starters, we order the chicken wings. It is perfectly crispy and pairs well with the amazing dipping sauce. I eat this spicy, delicious dipping sauce with everything including the crab fried rice. There is adequate amount of crab in this dish. Some people might find this dish bland but I think it's perfectly and adequately seasoned. I have tried their pad thai and panang curry and they are both very delicious.   Over all, Glai Baan has impressed us tremendously, from the authenticity, the service and the general vibe of the restaurant. Give this place a try, it won't disappoint.

AzcDtVfJBo9D6WsUo6HgFg.text: Thai food is my absolute favorite. After visiting Thailand it's been hard to find that authentic touch. Glai Baan provides that for us. The pork dumplings were so insanely great I had to order more (they took a while because they're freshly prepped/steamed..yes!). The bartender Bee, was nothing short of incredible. Extremely sweet and knowledgable. He had great suggestions. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gaFMUZZkUnJKTpMrkTth9w.text: This is some of the best Thai food I've ever had. I got the Roselle for a cocktail - like a sangria margarita. Fruity and refreshing. My friend and I split the pork dumplings. I loved the sauce that came with them. I got the crab fried rice and it was sooo tasty. I can't wait to come back.

X6X3S0IBfg_oDkNcHzy9XA.text: I had the crab fried rice and some chicken wings and omg this food is super delicious that I couldn't stop eating. This is a place I'll definitely recommend and go back to.

TEos1RpnD6dqQ5iIIcKQqA.text: How do I give this place 10 stars?  Solid gold. The decor, the friendly staff, the food. Everything was fantastic with the correct mix of flavors.   We started by sharing 3 of the small plates and one large. The Larb and wings were both perfect. For dessert we split the steamed bun and custard and also the sticky mango rice. Yum, yum and yum. The cocktails were enjoyable.  Overall our new fave in Phoenix.

2OWImykvzBdUExm2So9Q9A.text: A hidden gem in Phoenix! Amazing food and delicious drinks. You can tell the food is crafted to excellence. I ordered the Pad Kee Mao and it was so flavorful and filling! There was a bit of a wait when I arrived with my friend, but it was well worth the wait. I will definitely be back!

a2J3PJAzVG22NqoCA1dhXg.text: Amazing amazing amazing! From the best host dan at the door - amazing Thai food! I can't tell you enough go "yesterday" equal or better than easy coast selected Thai places in queens New York! I am here on business and I saw a review got this place and I'm glad I went!

PYximxsrrq1FBnYgsaTcIw.text: I've been wrestling for awhile as to whether or not I should review this place. My experience with Thai cuisine stems as far as ordering Pad Thai from Thai Express up the street from my apartment, so I keep telling myself that maybe my taste buds weren't built to handle traditional Asian cuisine. I mean, I'm half-Filipino, but that doesn't mean I know how to appreciate all other types of Asian delicacies. I finally decided to go through with this review, and I shall paint the picture for you.  I was visiting my friend who had recently moved out west from Columbus. This friend is even more well traveled than me, and spent six months in Thailand. He had heard of Glai Baan from various magazines and tv reports, and was overly intrigued by the thought of authentic Thai food. After all, he had spent most of college in Cincinnati experiencing the same Thai Express that I'm accustomed to, and Cbus doesn't exactly fit the bill for real deal Thai food either. All of this backstory is basically me explaining how pumped he was to try Glai, and how it ultimately let him down.  We ventured in on a Wednesday evening to find the restaurant pretty packed. Luckily, we were able to score a spot on their cute side patio. It was well lit and heated so it was the perfect dining spot. We both opted for beer (I am a fervent beer drinker, and my friend has some weird obsession with Thai beer.) Surprisingly, they had a nice mix of crafts from the west coast, so we were both happy with our drink selection.  I was leaning toward ordering the pad Thai because I'm basic/unfamiliar with Thai food, but the server steered me toward the green curry. My companion was super pumped because he could order kao soi, which is essentially Thailand's chicken noodle soup. Our food arrived, and we were taken aback by how pretty our plates looked. They were expertly put together and could have been an awesome addition to the 'gram. However, the consensus between our two dishes was that it was good, but we felt like there has to be better out there. For as pretty as my dish was, the toppings/noodle/broth ratio didn't feel very balanced, and I found many bites to be missing something. As for the kao soi, my friend liked it but noted that it didn't have the kick he found in many kao sois across Thailand. He added a lot of chilies; I thought it was cute that they had a little table side array of chilies available for her food. After all, I do enjoy the spice.  I would try here again if asked, simply because part of me feels like the dishes that were ordered on my trip weren't my cup of tea. I do love some pad Thai, and the pad kee moo sounds like something I could get behind. If I ever come back, I just hope the flavors are kicked up a notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special green curry of the day

8KriFVjQgJzC4r4Uej7tyQ.text: Went back and tried it again, they must have had an off night. Everything was pretty good. I like my food spicy and I think that's what was lacking bumped up my spicy level and honestly everything was a lot better

2vC_q1j4728FRQBPcpFXWg.text: Cool decorations and concept! This is the real street food because they put food on top of the rice. I mean lots of rice like I used to get in Thailand. The khao soi is uniquely tasty. It is creamy from the coconut milk but it is not too much and I can still taste the broth. Also the food here is not too sweet, which is similar to the food in Thailand.  I am looking forward to the dessert menu!

wb35yLNaVUTKVKevji7Yfw.text: Just stopped in for dinner, was absolutely great!  We had the Kao Soi and some spicy dish called Kapra... can't remember the rest of the name. The flavors in both of these were amazing and it was very filling.   The waitress was very friendly and attentive as well as the host. The outside area was very nice and nicely decorated.   HIGHLY recommend the thai custard dessert too, it was sooooo yummy!!!  Will be coming back. :)

9RAzzdt2pPYO6socjGY6zg.text: Omg this place is a hidden gem. I'm obsessed! Walking in, I felt like I was transported to a beautiful oasis of Thai food. The energy in this place is very ethereal with a street/urban flair. I truly love all the dishes I've tried, but especially the PadThai and Dumplings. The drinks are always a must here as well. I will be coming here for many years to come. Do yourself a favor and make reservations ahead of time because this place is crawling with people who want to get their Thai fix. Enjoy!

aL4wJ2rT0K6zi-2FU0TYSA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants ever! I love the food, the ambience is excellent and the staff is over the moon wonderful!!! Such original dishes and drinks. Reasonable prices. This is a must try place. It's always packed but it's worth the wait! Note they are planning to be closed to venture to Thailand July 28 th-August 22nd. Love you guys! Dan, Maxwell, and everyone I'll miss you when I move away but I'll always return to visit!!!

l_HbhHPLQdCyDMsQpfZNbA.text: This restaurant is so cozy and welcoming on the inside! Almost like visiting a friend or neighbor for a social gathering...that's the vibe in this restaurant. The service was excellent and timely. The bartenders and servers were friendly and made helpful menu suggestions. We ordered the Kanin jeeb (pork dumplings), which were delicious. My boyfriend even grabbed the dipping sauce off the plate as it was being cleared so we could continue to enjoy it with our other food! We also got a son-in-law egg which was a tasty bite. (And it was fun to try and guess why it's called a son-in-law egg...) I ordered the Panang curry, which was rich and savory and had an amazing flavor that was unlike any other curry I've ever had! Bf ordered the Pad kee mao, which was so flavorful that I couldn't stop stealing bites of it. For dessert, our server suggested a dish that was made of fluffy pieces of bread with a sweet syrupy custard like sauce to dip them in. I can't remember the name-but like our server said "It sounds weird, but somehow it just works." I couldn't agree more! We will definitely be back and I can't wait to try the other dishes!

-wquKO03umCLcvGIzeouYw.text: Soooooo yummy. Everything on the menu is good. Everything is extremely authentic. We always get the chicken wings. They have a good spice level here too. Not many places have the salted crab- so that's my favorite but you have to be a bold eater to like it. I would recommend going with someone and sharing everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry chicken with egg noodles

ypHHyAvC1GsSHTcoJPOWFQ.text: Favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Always worth the wait and never disappoints! The dumplings are always a must and always ask for their specials for the day. It can get busy during the weekends but they always do their best to get you in. Service is also really great too.

SpX69IJT-6wzoiIHRQHMyg.text: This is the best Thai restaurant I have found in Phoenix. Great food and excellent service.  The dumplings, Panang Curry and Pad kee mao are to die for. It is well worth the wait and Dan the owner is awesome. Great restaurant!

sKw1ttA631ukBEf1ZPoWuA.text: I have mixed feelings about writing a glowing review. First, I want them and everyone to know how great this place is but second I don't want my wait to be long when I go. BUT I will wait because it is so worth it.  To begin with the ambiance is relaxed with a good vibe moving throughout. The little bar area is fun and inviting. I love the patio and the overhanging trees.  The food is amazing. Small little dishes straight from the Thai streets. Fresh and full of flavor. I get the Som Tum wherever I go because I like to test the different recipes. This one here is perfect. Not too sweet like many others.  I've only been once so I haven't tried everything but we ordered the mince chicken twice! So tasty.  I've been telling everyone I know to try this place. Great for date night!  Well done! I will be back again and again.

wpBkffEwlfyBvv9iq2IKqw.text: Best meal out that we have had in ages. We had been wanting to try Glai Baan for some time now. It did not disappoint.  The dumplings were amazing. We split the Pad kee mao with chicken. The tastes were amazing, service was impeccable. We had to wait, but it was so worth it. Do yourself a favor and visit this place.

Gh3PySrzzBE5eZuDUAFxLw.text: Slow start as in we were seated quickly but then ignored for a bit. But once we were "discovered" everyone was very attentive. Started with the dumplings which were absolutely divine.  The food was amazing spicy to perfection I had spice level 3 which was perfect amount of heat for me   The atmosphere is cozy business is brisk. I will definitely be back

L68clggBdZU0evCK_E2qNQ.text: What can I say? Maybe, "the best Thai it town" or "I've never had better green papaya salad (tom sum)", but that's not enough! This place is THE place for Thai food, an authentic carnival of Thai flavor. Ever dish is wonderfully spiced, and umami in only the way the Thai do! The atmosphere is nicely comfortable like being at home (it is in an old house). Plan your meal ahead as this place is small so you may have to wait for a table, but it's time well spent! Further more, the staff and owner are really friendly.

XXfWoezGJhIP4sdSZhKIiA.text: Loud, cramped, crowded, hip, overpriced, dark, trendy. Very limited menu with small, overpriced portions. The special appetizer was great but tiny and overpriced. Both entrees were excessively noodle-y, one extremely bland and gummy, the other tasty but mostly noodles and curry. Very few vegetables in either entree. Limited drink selections. Nearly $50 plus tip for two entrees and one appetizer, no drinks. I woke up very hungry the next morning.

r0a5fwlJYC0F4BGM9r9ACQ.text: What a gem this is!  I never considered myself a fan of Thai food however, after visiting Glai Baan, I have recategorized myself as a fan of AUTHENTIC Thai cuisine.  It's an unassuming exterior with a warm, kitschy interior.  The staff was amazing offering just the right amount of assistance.  The pork dumplings are a must-try as well as the 'drunken noodles. The beef in the red curry was tender like short ribs and was perfectly seasoned.  Their cocktail menu offers unique options that are definitely worth trying.   My fear is that I have tried the best and now, nothing else will compare!

a71_HzLqQgcGyKxcO4cxYQ.text: So freaking good and fun and delicious. If you need a Thai fix with friends al fresco or at the bar with Max, you will enjoy your visit to Glai Baan! My recommendation is to try everything - yet to go wrong from Mackerel fried rice to excellent pork and vegetarian dishes yum.....

0sK6mbrM9eB7i8ImCYOZbA.text: Such a quaint little space. Love the flavors... everything taste wonderful and fresh. Such a great Thai restaurant... not your typical Americanized Thai restaurants you'll find around the valley. Where else can you find chicken heart BBQ skewer?!! The salted crab papaya salad is really refreshing! Great wine selection as well. I don't think I've ever been to any Thai restaurant in the metro Phoenix area that has decent wine selection and this place has great selection to pair with your food.

_AI8HD9V0pSJfUpbRyIsRg.text: We can't wait to come back and give them a try at a 5 star rating. The food and service are probably there, but it is a bit cramped and this is a personal thing, but i don't like drinking water out of a tin cup. I get that it may be a cute to some, but I'm not a fan. The service was super friendly and attentive. They have a well oiled machine and all work together in harmony. Creates a nice and enjoyable atmosphere, everyone was happy to be there! The food was enjoyable as well. Very fresh, tasty and well prepared. Our server had superior knowledge of the menu and was able to guide us in the direction we wanted to go. The Pad Thai was really yummy, the Larb and salad we had were awesome too.   Good experience, can't wait to go back and try more delicious Thai food!

HngIpkvE6qsA9eIeeWOPCQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix right now... great food + great atmosphere/decor.  I love it.

-CxorYY77y6ku1qbqWa3nw.text: I wish I lived in PHX so i can come back to try their drinks and try other dishes!  The vibe here is awesome. I really liked the space and the lighting to make it such a chill but not making me sleepy type of setting.   The food:  We started with the appetizer pork bone soup. Forgot the actual name for it on the menu but this was amazing!! The meat fell off the bone and it was definitely something I would order again. The crab fried rice was delicious. It could use a little more time in the wok but still was good. It came with a side of fish sauce that i definitely used all of it.   I would come back!

sxWTJRCDW2QCN5KI4g0Vsg.text: The best of authentic Thai food! Great Ambiance with an outside patio. I love their dumplings!  Owners are so friendly and accommodating! Highly recommend!

j5EGGscl5y8NBJ_y822RCg.text: 3 stars for the excellent service and very nice ambiance! Foods were not what I expected Pork skewers was flavorful but other than that nothing is memorable. Sausages taste off lack of herbs and seasoning, Kao soi wasn't close to what I had in Chieng-mai, Kana moo grob was good but came out with 4 pieces of pork belly didnt worth the $14, Pandan cream desert was really bland and too small portion.

I look forward to coming back and trying other dishes.

zLiaWjSe-GvGM_Kz4G89eg.text: Absolute best Thai street food ever. I have enjoyed everything I've had. Small venue, but never a long wait. Everyone so great and attentive!

khSVN-ElGZKXznwyBoBYBw.text: Delicious!  The food was fantastic and the ambiance was adorable. Our favorite things were the beef panang curry (a special) and the "adult" Thai tea (Thai tea spiked with rum).  We will definitely be back!

SdwHc6znj99Q9ufUhxbPig.text: DUMPLINGS, DUMPLINGS, DUMPLINGS. My lovely wife and I ordered one each of dumplings, absolute best. All the while the dark beer is not too bad and the special pork belly is hot. It's actually spicy. Love this place. Please open for lunch.

uAYcz4hp1k2LIYFqap82fw.text: We stopped in for a dinner a few weeks ago and arrived right at opening time in order to snag a table without a wait.  The restaurant is cozy and comfortable, the staff is friendly and the food is quite good.  We shared the pork dumplings and I had the pad kee mao with pork for my entree.  Quite good and a nice addition to the neighborhood!

f6xy8gq--2izuk-_PxO6EQ.text: First time in tonight and the soup was unreal! One of the best Thai soups I can remember having. The space is homey and relaxed but the dishes are world class. I am looking forward to returning soon. The bartender Maxwell was very helpful and was totally on point with the drink recommendations. Very impressed on round one.

7C5NH0t5W6vfaBw9mmN_AA.text: Solid place.  Our new favorite Thai restaurant .  Great patio on the side. We got there at 4:55 on a Saturday and there were already 6 other ppl waiting to get in when it iopens. So the word is already out on this place.

f3hWsEjp4QX_MJAg0IWSsw.text: Wow. I don't write many reviews but you should totally go here. My boyfriend and I came here late at night, and were totally impressed. Great food, amazing service, absolutely lovely experience. Thank you!

QOTKq_ECngFim37T9NEJLg.text: WOW! and YUM! One of the best Thai meals of my life. And I've eaten at Kin Khao in SF, and Pok Pok in Portland, for reference. (Kin Khao was the best hands down.) Glai Baan is game changer for PHX dining. Thai was a glaring weak point locally until this place, at least in my experience. Now we have a place better than almost anywhere I could find when I lived back East. Several of the tastes I had today I preferred to my Pok Pok Portland experiences. The pork skewers were absolutely perfect, made by someone who cared about my personal happiness, I swear. The dumplings were just about perfect. Papaya salad was very light and flavorful and refreshing. The Ka Na Moo Grob was soulful and deeply gratifying to eat. One miss was the fried chicken wings. They were fine, nicely fried, but the little bit of sauce they came with wasn't enough to really make them stand out from fried chicken anywhere else. I was hoping for more of a flavor punch. I cannot wait to try everything else on the menu. Service was good. There was a short wait for our party of 3 on a Wednesday night.

DS6JpwyxCtSpr7LU0uC9TA.text: This is the best Thai food I have had in the valley by a long shot (been to Thailand). Going to want start with the mussels, the broth that the mussels are served in takes me straight back to Thailand. The dumplings are great as well, we are pretty much going to come back here until we have tried everything on this menu. Everett was our server, guy is a legend. Great service, great atmosphere, keep up the great work!

vjHMgsu6HdLhkQIY5foUDQ.text: This place is awesome, fantastic food and decor. The drinks are great I would absolutely recommend it if you're looking for a Thai food experience that you can't get anywhere else in the valley.

VNbPqvhNn41oxLPGWwB6xQ.text: The drinks were very tasty and the chicken wings were delicious. Our main course took about 40 minutes to come out and was very anti-climatic. The food tasted decent so I won't give it a bad rating but for how long it took and the taste I certainly won't give it much more than three. We will definitely be back for drinks. Great ambiance!

4rejD3fIeQ7ZGWmUbw50fw.text: Very disappointed first (and last) time here.  Very nice decor and ambiance, but it is overpriced, overly small portions, and the food is nothing special.  I love Thai food and have spent time in Thailand, and this just did not measure up. I ordered the green curry, and it did not look like the picture of it posted here  as there was almost no sauce-very unusual for a curry.  Very small portion.  I had that and water to drink. My friend had a small plate and a tea.   Our tab was around $40 with tip and we left there still hungry.   Ridiculous in my opinion.  I will be sticking to my favorite Thai restaurant on Central that not only serves up value for the money, but outstanding taste, and I never leave there hungry. For the same price we paid at Glai Baan, we would have had a feast- much more and better food- and been much more satisfied..

mcuDQCLN5t37OXYJ66hdiA.text: Love this place!!  Service was top notch. Food was amazing. Got the Pad Kee Mao and the Dumplings.  Delicious!!!!

6UFohMPRAC4nhxRRekajmw.text: Delicious Thai food. We had four times and shared all of them and each was fantastic. We will be back.

WyyrlhiDxvUAcJHlPpvopA.text: Our good friend Tom G. recommended this exceptional new Thai restaurant. We joined him there last night and sat at the bar with Maxwell. The food was unreal! We did family style so we could try multiple items. All the flavors were incredible & our mixologist/bartender was knowledgeable & hilarious. This place is one of our new favorite spots & the Chef/Owner even came out at the end and spoke with us. She was delightful. We were extremely impressed to say the least. Love the friendly staff, the delicious food and the first-rate service!!! Check it out and hang with Maxwell if there is open space at the bar. You'll be glad you did :D

bqpMDQxV1Nsy5pWo8H89hQ.text: Food and ambiance were excellent. The decor is very inviting and loved the outdoor patio. Our favorite was the mackerel fried rice and the crab papaya salad. Their Thai tea was great - not too sweet. We will be back soon.

pnY-WjsYDYLehzrvZ31xmw.text: This place is amazing! The atmosphere is so nice and the staff was super friendly. My friend was a regular and they all knew her name. The pad Thai, dumplings, and steak skewers were incredible. I wanted to take a box of the dumplings home with me! I will definitely be returning!

wlXaJhFtelcBMU4NdJXbdw.text: Barely receiving my meal and it has been amazing since we got here! It was a great spontaneous place for a first date with my roomie! The owners, wait staff and bartender all went out of their way to give genuine exchanges. The customer service is genuine and great. I will be back again. To top it off the owner is a cook and t is soooo good. They were very accommodating with my porkless needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Glai Baan - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My two favorite things: tea and alcohol!  Its sweet and very delicious.

6bbALuhRyG2jqbyVO14Vng.text: This is such an amazing, friendly, and delicious new place. By far the most friendly and service oriented staff. Dan and his wife (owners) have one bad ass restaurant and you should check them out ASAP

QdYM1rPJxBGxRFHN45yroA.text: Great new spot in the hood! If you can, sit at the bar and let Maxwell take great care of you. Skip the menu and just take his recommendations. This place feels cozy and hip without trying too hard. The pork dumplings were my favorite. Mango sticky rice was delightful.

HpgUji2pX5vZA3n1L89Hdw.text: Expensive. Overrated. Was not what I expected. I would rather go to Reathrey Sekong for a True Thai / Cambodian authentic experience. Food here not as good has such little portions. I thought it was going to be like pok pok in Portland Oregon. But It was such a disappointment. I won't be back here again. The wait was too long to pick up food. The waiters were nice at all. I kept getting ignored because people wanted to sit down and eat and I want to order to go.

MlDgn-riyxA1Sio8p2B-lg.text: It was so great to find this place. Authentic Thai food is hard to come by and we are lucky to have this so close to home. Pork steamed buns were excellent. The Penang curry was as good as I've tasted in Thailand and Australia. Great setting too. Support this locally owned restaurant!

29qo5C_o4LaenhUxqei2cg.text: My friend suggested coming here for my birthday.Every plate was savory.Recalling the sauces,tastes,and textures induces copious salivation.Service was friendly and attentive,making for an experience that aptly fit the occasion.Special Thx to Kat,Dan,and our bartender Dan.

RIgjBw3x2I-7ftFmAft27w.text: So dang good. Rivals any Thai food I've had anywhere - NYC, San Francisco, Chicago, LA. Delicate, flavorful but not heavy or overdone, fresh, perfectly cooked, AND affordable in a cute location with a cool vibe. This place nails it. Completely worth hunting for a parking space.

TatZ9TYz7iwbpyJ6jg6C-A.text: Probably won't ever come here again. The portions are ridiculously small for a 15 dollar plate. The pad see ew should have been able to feed two people for that price but could barely even satisfy 1 from the amount they put. Tasted great but you would need to pay 45 bucks to feed one person.

JqO0QC8zDPFioGd0045Jtw.text: I've been to Glai Baan twice now and have been rewarded with very flavorful and authentic Thai street food.  I spent 2 weeks in Thailand and can confirm that it is like eating on the streets of Bangkok.  Their pad thai and noodle soup were both on point.  Maxwell, their bartender, makes a mean cocktail as well, try the Disappearing Door made with a local rum!

UubdK45TTno7RdrP4oYpfA.text: I love this place!! Unique, Fun and Vibrant. Food is truly amazing, True tase of Thai food. Service is impeccable, highly recommended.

eedZG67uGGx-zhm-S8LslA.text: We had a fantastic Saturday night dinner at Glai Baan! Service was spot-on and the ambiance was trendy but cozy. Every single dish we got was excellent. My favorites in particular were the pork skewers and the mussels. Also, definitely get the kanom custard for dessert! We will be returning soon to try the rest of the menu. If you are looking for a delicious and slightly more upscale Thai dining experience, give Glai Baan a try.

3curhKO2DxgL2R3mzGdbYQ.text: This is such a great spot! Super yummy food, as spicy as you want!! Friendly owners and bartender, great atmosphere and ambience. I will definitely be back regularly. Finally a great Thai place close to home. Thank you for the wonderful experience!
